182501.name: Desafío Energético
182501.description:
Desafío Energético is a family boardgame about the development of the oil industry and the distribution of its products to different regions in Argentina.

It's a game of two to four players with a duration of 30-45 minutes.
The goal is to get as many points through the fuel supply to different provinces , building refineries and developing production areas.

To supply a province, the player must place chips in each area of the production chain : exploration, production , refining and transport networks , which connect these boxes with different provinces.
During his turn , the player can make one of two choices:

Take two cards from the deck.
Change 3 or 4 equal cards to place tiles on the board and expand the network.

182502.name: Dragon Radieux (Issue 12 - Nov 1987)
182502.description:
Dragon Radieux
Revue Bimestrielle des Jeux de Rôles
No. 12 - Novembre 1987

La Saga des Morts-Vivants - Squelettes, Linceuls, Vampires...

182503.name: Madame Winter (ICONS)
182503.description:
From publisher blurb:

It was Natasha's dream to become the epitome of the fairytale. She had it all. Money, respect, and a mob boss for a husband. No one knows how she survived the plane crash that killed her dream or gave her fantastic powers. All everyone can agree on is that she has used these new found gifts to cut her way to the top of the crime family her husband once ruled. Beware the icy stare of Madame Winter!

182504.name: Dragon Radieux (Issue 17 - Sep 1988)
rpgissuearticle: Legendes de la Vallee des Rois
Les Jeux Dont on Parlera en 89
Règles avancées de Donjons et Dragons
182504.description:
Dragon Radieux
Revue Bimestrielle des Jeux de Rôles
No. 17 - Septembre 1988

Scénarios Guerre des Etoiles, Appel de Cthulhu, AD&D, Légendes de la Vallée des Rois

182505.name: Carapace
182505.description:
From publisher blurb:

Near mindless engine of destruction, Carapace's name strikes fear in the hearts of entire teams when forced to confront him. Do your heroes have what it takes to stop this juggernaut? Or will they, too, fall broken at his feet like so many noble stalwarts before them?

Carapace is a PL 14 threat to add to your Mutants & Masterminds campaign.

The ALGERNON Files Deluxe Edition is a treasure trove of enemies, allies, locations, and items of power to add to any ongoing M&M game. The series updates the fan-favorite ALGERNON Files material to the 3rd edition of the game and expands it, adding many new and exciting characters to meet and places to go.

The series is presented as files being transferred (and commented on) from the databases of the AI known as ALGERNON (who supports The Sentinels' superteam) to the possession of The Challenger Institute for curation. Each entry contains a character or other material of note ready to be dropped into a broad variety of adventures and settings with little or no work on the part of enterprising Gamemasters.

182506.name: Actual Cannibal Shia LaBeouf
182506.description:
Author's introduction:

You’re walking in the woods. There’s no one around and your phone is dead. Out of the corner of your eye you spot him...

Shia LaBeouf

He gets down on all fours and breaks into a sprint! He’s gaining on you!

Actual Cannibal Shia Labeouf is a micro-RPG based on a humorous song by Rob Cantor, in which Shia Labeouf tracks and devours hapless victims.

182507.name: Lorestar
182507.description:
Somewhere in our galaxy, a small, starless planet wanders aimlessly inside of a vast nebula. Highly advanced satellites that the inhabitants think of as gods - “Lorestars” - orbit this world, periodically irradiating the surface in an endless cycle of long-abandoned experiments. The native lifeforms and human settlers live a primitive state of violence because of the volatile effects that the satellites have had on their genetics over the centuries. When specific satellites are in certain parts of their orbits, the bursts of radiation even cause some inhabitants to change into alien monsters.

In this part of the Lorestar story, you play as one of five unique characters that turn into savage creatures when their satellite god passes through the right constellation. Vying for survival in the wild outskirts of small towns, some of these characters, like the planet they live on, are confused wanderers, while others take advantage of their abilites to ruthlessly hold power over weaker people.

Control the position of the Lorestar icons by outsmarting your opponents in a simultaneous card draw that spins the central game board. Once your character has turned into a monster by aligning the Lorestars in the inner board to the constellations on the outer board, play attack cards and use your monster abilities to continue to foil your opponents and dwindle their health until you're the last monster standing.

Survive this battle and unlock the next chapter of Lorestar!

182509.name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Airco DH.2
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War
182509.description:
From the publisher:

The Airco DH.2 was a single-seat biplane “pusher” aircraft that was the first effectively armed British single-seat fighter. It enabled Royal Flying Corps (RFC) pilots to counter the “Fokker Scourge”, that had given to the Germans air superiority in late 1915. The DH.2 and similar aircraft carried the burden of fighting and escort duties. Great Aces gloriously piloted this aircraft: Robert Saundby, John Oliver Andrews and Lanoe Hawker.

Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW1 Wings of Glory Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards.

182510.description:
Ravage – Dungeons of Plunder for 1-5 players.

A dungeon-delving board game where you, the player, get to control a band of Orcs; ain’t no paladins or dwarfs here. Raid dungeons, slaughter monsters for their teef and complete objectives and level up along the way.

'Game Modes'
Ravage is for 1-5 players and boasts 3 game modes

'Solo'
Survive the dungeon and its random boss encounter for victory, there is no resurrection in this mode.
Approx 25-45 minutes.

'Adventure (co-op)'
Play co-operatively with your friends to complete quests, bury the head, defeat the cave serpent and slaughter the spider’s lair.
Approx 60-90 minutes with or without a Dungeon Master.

'Treachery (vs)'
You each control the dungeon and monsters, pitting them against your friends, setting off traps, looting your opponents whilst you try to keep the dungeon at bay. Each hero kill will gain you promotions, become the war chief to win.
Approx 60-90 minutes

Choose your hero’''
You get to pick from one of the 4 castes:
Berserker - Unleash powerful attacks charge at your enemies, frenzy and attack multiple foes.
Shaman - Using your tribal magic transform into a raven or a bear, summon spirits and blood wield your enemies.
Cultist - Inflict fear, life drain your enemies and even summon the undead to fight for you.
Headhunter - Use poison and flaming arrows to destroy your enemies and even take head shots.

Experience and Levelling Up
Each hero has a set of weapons and ability cards that require energy to use, once you have enough energy you can unleash these devastating attacks on your enemies. Exhausted energy turns into experience, gain enough experience and level up your abilities.

Exploring
The dungeon is presented in a deck of cards, cards are drawn each turn for you to explore the dungeon, they include hallways or room cards, for you to construct your dungeon randomly every time. You will encounter traps as you traverse through the dungeon it’s not a safe place to be, as you and your friends will discover.

Looting
If you die your loot either sits by the trap that killed you or with the monster that killed you and runs around the dungeon with it until slain, anyone can claim your loot.

Resurrection
If you have enough resurrection tokens, you may resurrect on any of the resurrection points in the dungeon, these are limited so take care. If at any time a player dies and cannot resurrect you fail your quest.

Monsters
Monsters are a plenty, and they are all heading for you, each monster has a critical success ability, you can aggro monsters and they will make attacks of opportunity. Slaying monsters gains you teef, which you can spend at the sneaky goblin and remember Teef = Money.

Bosses
You encounter bosses in the campaign or randomly after a set time in the solo mode, each boss has its own unique ability cards it will use to decimate you and your friends so beware.
182510.name: Ravage: Dungeons of Plunder

182511.name: Rise of the Kage: Docks of Ryu
182511.description:
Rise of the Kage: Docks of Ryu expansion sees the ninja of the shadow wind clan come up against the brutal Minato and his trusted dock guards. Make your way through junks, warehouses and markets on your way to the summit of Ryu. With new maps, custom missions, guards and ninja the adventure continues in Rise of the Kage: Docks of Ryu.

This expansion includes:

20 plastic miniatures

1 double sided game board

16 game cards

4 player mats

Note: Rise of the Kage: Docks of Ryu is an expansion and requires the base game of Rise of the Kage.

182512.name: You are the Ref
182512.description:
Test your friends and family in football knowledge. Based on the classic "YOU ARE THE REF" strip from The Observer, you take on the role as a football referee.

As you move along the board you will pick up scenario cards based on the laws of the game.

Each scenario has three possible outcomes but only one of them is correct. The question is which? You have to be quick though, as in football, you don’t have long to think about your decision; only 15 seconds or the game moves on.

Each time you answer correctly, you will get a match card in the colour of the field.

The first to visit all six different colours and answer correctly will win the game. But be careful; you can be challenged in your knowledge by your opponents and might have to hand over one of your match cards.

All the scenarios and answers in the You are the Ref board game have been written by international football referee Keith Hackett and the scenario cards are accompanied by the art of Paul Trevillion.

182513.description:
Extra gift promotion for the Piñata party.
Additional moving mechanism card to the base game.
182513.name: Piñata party: Essen extra promo

182515.description:
Description from the publisher:

Theseus: The Dark Orbit – Hunters, the second faction expansion for Theseus, contains a faction that employs trickery and subterfuge to their advantage. Hiding in the shadows, the Hunters can steal bonus cards and upgrade tokens, use enemy cards through hacking, and remotely trigger their own action cards. The Hunters also have the unique ability of leaving Theseus by hiding in their capsule just outside the space station.
182515.name: Theseus: The Dark Orbit – Hunters

182516.name: Game for Fame
182516.description:
Game for Fame is the party board game that separates the A-List from the Zzz-List, and just like the real world of celebrity you don't need any talent to win.

Work towards the red carpet (and avoid Re-hab) by working in teams in a number of fun games such as trying to talk with your tongue hanging out your mouth or guess which accent your team is attempting. But don't get too friendly, as players also have to backstab their team mates for solo cash prizes.

In Game For Fame there can only be one winner, the player with the most money.

182517.name: EverDark
182517.description:
In EverDark, players make their way through the forest (represented by a single deck of cards) and try to assemble the highest valued hands possible by collecting special combinations of cards.

It won’t be without surprises though, as several negative-valued wolves are on the prowl, and a notorious thief calls the forest home.

182518.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Battle of Pegasus Bridge began minutes after the Allied invasion of Normandy and was crucial in defending against the Axis counterstrike following their loss on the beach. The airborne unit that landed at Pegasus Bridge were tasked with holding the bridge against the German forces.

Recreate this epic battle with the Heroes of Normandie: Pegasus Bridge new scenario pack!
182518.name: Heroes of Normandie: Pegasus Bridge

182519.description:
Description from the publisher:

During WWII, civilians from every type of background were displaced and caught in the line of fire.

Heroes of Normandie: Civilians Under Fire contains four punchboards of tokens that allow you to add the Mayor, the Priest, and more to your campaigns. Use the new recruitment tiles with terrifying Ilda, the She Wolf of the SS, or heroic Sandy leading the French resistance group, The FFI. Never underestimate the power of the civilians!
182519.name: Heroes of Normandie: Civilians Under Fire

182520.name: ASL Comp Afrikakorps: Battle of Gazala
182520.description:
(from the introduction:)

Welcome to ASLComp AFRIKAKORPS, an ASLComp Variant series of scenario packs. All of the scenarios in this series are played on one or more copies of the 22" x 34" TOBRUK desert maps and using an all new set of overlays.

This expansion includes a map, counters and scenarios. Free bonus die-cut counters are provided in AK #1 and #7.

The collection of 100 historical scenarios depicts actions across the length and breadth of the Western Desert and Tunisia during World War II.

182521.name: Testament
182521.description:
User Summary

Testament is a bible game for PC, an action adventure, seen in third person. The player plays as a angel, trying to help different people from the bible, and to fight enemies with weapons and/or "powers". The angel can be leveled, and for each part of the game the enemies gets stronger. The game has six parts.

182522.name: Adventure Module M3: The City Under the Mountain
182522.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the third and final instalment in the Echo of Days Past campaign arc - M3: The City Under the Mountain. In M1 and M2, your players developed from first level beginning characters to sixth level warriors and mages. This final instalment will see them progress along the path of greatness to 8th Level. The story presses on from the end of M2: Beneath the Razor’s Edge and sees the party enter the conquered dwarven realm of Skard.

The quest is fought over six levels and takes place entirely in Skard under the Razor’s Edge mountain chain.

It consists of:

Entry to Skard: The characters have to force their way into Skard and break into the entry halls of the once great dwarf realm.
The Power Source: This section sees the party investigate the dwarven water works where they will meet a deranged sorceror and his creation, the Mechatron.
The Fire Pit: From The Power Source, the characters enter The Fire Pit, where they will encounter the great river of fire, Khunmir, and best their nemesis Zaleria’s overseer, Muzmed before heading north to....
Gam Daruhl: The dwarven city of Gam Daruhl is now a hotbed of Khanoumid power. Here the characters must defeat the Khanoumid General Arhab as well as evil forces summoned by Zaleria to root out the last dwarves of the realm.
The Aerie: Fresh air at last as the party heads east and up to the Aerie. This fissure in the mountain is now controlled by Zaleria’s second in command, Zorander and his Beast Riders.
The Temple: Once a dwarven palace, now converted into a temple of Ehalazuhn. Here the party will finally engage the leader of the conquered domain and High Priestess of Ehalazuhn, Zaleria. From here they pass beyond the material world into the Throne Room of Ehalazuhn himself for a final showdown.




M3: The City Under the Mountain is a challenging campaign designed to take characters from 1st Level to 8th Level in the world’s greatest RPG. It is intended for the most recent version of this great game but could easily be converted to other editions. It concludes an epic quest which began with M1: An Echo of Days Past and continued in M2: Beneath the Razor’s Edge - both of which recieved good reviews. The three modules, all available on DriveThruRPG and RPGNow, form an adventure arc running to over 240 pages of varied and exciting encounters and experiences.

The content of this module can be played as a continuing campaign (as intended) or can be used to flesh out any current home grown campaign which might include an underground city.

182523.name: The Norni
182523.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Norni supported the fledgling rebellion. When the Imperial Armada arrived, the Rebels fled and the Empire bombed the planet making it an example to any who would oppose their power. Cvilized worlds turned their backs on the refugees out of fear of imperial reprisals. The Norni are a people without a home, fated to wander the stars.

Included is information on the Norni and their culture, the Norni Star Wanderer Racial Class, and twenty adventure hooks.

Also included is Lady Iliza, Mistress of the Void, a powerful Void Knight villian for use in your campaigns.

182524.name: Eilidh Class Interceptor
182524.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The space craft introduced in this installment of the series is a lightly armed 20 dT interceptor.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

182525.name: Bibelspelet
182525.description:
User Summary

Bibelspelet is a trivia game for PC. In the game players, or groups of players, can compete against each other in this bible trivia. The questions are in 5 categories: "To whom was it said?", "Who said?", "The missing word", "In which context - OT", and "In which context - NT". All the money from the game went to ADRA Sweden. The winner is the player/team that first answer one question right from each category.

182526.name: Needle Roc
182526.description:
Publisher blurb:

In the mountain heights hunts the needle roc. Much larger than its smaller eagle cousin, the needle roc is a raptor with a particularly distinctive hunting style: it flies past prey and threats alike, popping the viciously hooked quills along its wings to eviscerate those unlucky enough to have earned its ire. Between its large size, viciously hooked talons and twelve-foot quilled wingspan, this beast is a terror to watch out for.

Mountain Terrors: Needle Roc is a bestiary PDF for the Chronicle System, the rules engine that powers our popular A Song of Ice & Fire Roleplaying game.

rpgitemversion: PDF extended version of  Golden Sky Stories Bonus Material
182527.name: The Colors of the Sky: Bonus Material for Golden Sky Stories
182527.description:
From the DrivethruRPG store page

The Colors of the Sky is a collection of bonus material for Golden Sky Stories: Heart-Warming Role-Playing, offering new character types, scenarios, stories, and more.


Five New Character Types: The sneaky mouse henge, the gruff but protective wolf henge, the swift and friendly pony henge, the distant and beautiful fish henge, and the mysterious witch.



Strangers in a Strange Land: In this pair of scenarios, Rodrigo Garcia Carmona provides two very human tales about two boys and their relationships with the town.



Henge Candies: Allen Varney presents a guide to henge’s favorite candies, and how they can be a part of your stories.



Tales: These are two prose short stories from the world of Golden Sky Stories. In “A Lively Summer” a grieving window gets a visit from Sarah the bird henge, and in “Kaminaga-hime’s Soccer Ball” the spider goddess contends with kids playing a game on her mountain.

182529.name: Strategic Decision: World War II
182529.description:
Strategic Decision: World War II covers the entire Second World War, from Poland to Nagasaki, from the Panama Canal to Bombay to Archangelsk to New York. High Strategic level gaming at the Army/Army Group level, and with unit production. No dice, no cards, nothing random used - you've only got yourself to blame if you lose! Two joined vinyl water-resistant maps: the Pacific (~21" x 14") and European/African/MidEast (~27" x 20") theatres are included.

For 2-6 players, the belligerents include Germany, Britain, France, Italy, the Soviet Union, China, Japan, the USA and major neutrals such as Poland, Yugoslavia, Greece, Turkey, Sweden and Spain. In the two-player game, it's the Axis (Germans, Italians, Japanese) against the Allies (USA, Britain, Soviets, France, China). There are three counter sheets of 88 5/8" counters each representing the land, air, naval and logistical units, mostly at the Army/Army Group level (infantry, tank/panzer, mech, shock, guards, SS, etc), with specialty units such as marines and paratroops. Air units represent tactical attack aircraft and strategic aircraft, including heavy strategic aircraft (B-29) and even atomics. The naval forces are flotillas of fighting ships, carrier task forces, landing craft and convoys. Logistical units play a major role in the game - no supplies, no attacks.

Turns are quarterly, and proceed over two maps, one of Europe/North Africa/Middle East and one of Asia and the Pacific, with the US East Coast on the former and the West Coast on the latter. Units appear historically, but their entry can be altered when the players change historical invasion dates. There are many political rules that reflect the limits that the historical leaders faced.

As units are eliminated, they enter replacement pools and it is then up to the players to decide what branch gets priority in production: will the German player seek panzers for the Eastern Front, supplies for North Africa, or Tactical aircraft vs Britain? The allies can share resources up to a point, and lend lease may be all that keeps the Soviets from folding early.

Players are free to try alternate strategies. Should the Germans hit Turkey to open a back door to the Middle East, the Suez and Baku? Should the US hit Japan hard early, or put the emphasis on stopping Germany? Should Japan join Germany's crusade against bolshevism or put the emphasis on naval victories?

Weather is incredibly important, affecting every turn except Summer. Winter slows everything down - except the Soviets.

There are no dice in this game! Hitler didn't roll the dice, and neither did Stalin, Roosevelt, Hirohito, Mussolini or Churchill. They made decisions and lived with them. You'll do the same. There are no randomization of effects at all. Each of your actions determines your fate, as does your opponent's. There is no dice to bail you out or ruin your plans - you have only yourself and your opponent to blame for that!

Yet each game takes a different path. It is possible for Italy to be the last Axis player standing. It's possible for the Allies to knock Japan out a year early or liberate Eastern Europe without the Soviets. The Soviets might just take all of Europe. All of these outcomes happened in actual games. Each turn requires you to plan ahead, to anticipate enemy moves and your counter to them.

182530.description: Secrets of the Lost Tomb Core Adventurers Miniatures include each of the character adventurers that are in the 1st Edition Core Set of the game. The core game includes punch board standees for each character and these Miniatures replace those standees. These minis help bring your game to the next Epic Level.
182530.name: Secrets of the Lost Tomb: Core Adventurers Miniatures

182531.name: River of No Return
182531.description:
Icy cold water. Raging rapids. Deadly drops. Massive rocks that could easily flip a raft over. This is the Anacasta- the River of No Return.

But you have an experienced guide with you, so the Anacasta should be no problem. Until the guide jumps out of your raft to save a drowning woman. Now you're in charge of the boat, and there's a fork in the river. Go one way, and you'll have a safe, smooth trip down the rest of the river. Go the other way, and you'd better be wearing your life vest.

Quoted from the back of the book.

182532.name: Rapidoodle
182532.description:
You’ve got four basic shapes and only ONE MINUTE, can you doodle something different over each one? Rapidoodle is the fast-moving picture drawing game where drawing different wins!

Players all start with the same four shapes, then doodle over them to create four different pictures. If no one else doodled the same picture, you score! Rapidoodle challenges players to be original while fighting the clock. When creativity is king, will your doodles be one-of-a-kind? The more creative you are the more you win.

182533.name: Dice Chasers
182533.description:
A press-your-luck dice game where you earn chips based upon the results of rolling four dice. Every time you roll two or more matching dice, you earn chips. You can choose to reroll as many times as you like to earn more chips but as soon as your roll shows no matches, you bust and lose the chips you earned that turn.

When you bust, roll a single die and note the number, then select one of the upright cups from the center of the table. Either keep the cup for yourself or give it to another player. Whoever takes the cup flips it upside down and either loses, gains, or steals chips equal to the number rolled. Play continues until all cups are flipped over (with a special rule for the last cup). The player with the most chips wins.

182534.name: Chapas
182534.description:
From the publisher:

One of the most popular traditional games. Made up of 26 bottle-caps, 2 halves of a ball and cardboard discs on to which the caps must be thrust. Drawing a football pitch on the floor, take it in turns to flick the bottle-caps into your opponent’s goal. Presented in a cloth bag and a vintage style cardboard box.

182535.name: Word Shuffle
182535.description: Word Shuffle is a spelling game, but one that can be played in English, French and Spanish. Words are scored based on letter value and the use of wild cards, and words from all three languages can be played simultaneously.

182536.name: Circular Dominoes
182536.description:
From the Publisher's site:

An original way to play this classic game of dominos. When the pieces are placed together they form a circle. The vintage illustrated cardboard pieces create a different scene with each game. Presented in a vintage style cardboard box.

182538.name: Lay it or Break it
182538.description:
Get into this crazy race where you try to save eggs from the frying pan and take them back to the safety of their nest. Two players, at the same time, will try to move the eggs without breaking them. Use the Chicken Magnets to carefully lift the eggs and take them back to the nest. The player with the most unbroken eggs will be the winner!

Players each clip the magnet, dangling by a string, to their belt/waistband, like a tail. They squat and pick up an egg from the pile in the frying pan. Then, carefully, they walk/waddle over to their "nest", and gently, without using their hands, use the nest to separate the egg from the magnet. If the egg drops, it will break apart, and the yolk will spill out. Players compete to rescue the most eggs.

182539.name: Hacknet
videogamehonor: 2014 AGD Awards Excellence In Innovation Winner
182539.description:
Hacknet is a modern, super immersive terminal-driven hacking game with a fully internally-consistent network simulation and an interface so real you shouldn't play it in an airport.
It follows the story of recently deceased hacker "Bit", whose death may not be the 'accident' the media reports.

You stand in for no one, as most games have you do - play for yourself, make your own decisions, and see the world react - if you're leaving a trace that is.

Hacknet has no protagonist, other than the person using it. Don't be reckless though - it's more real than you think.

Source: The Game Website.

182540.name: Robots & Rockets
182540.description:
Robot tourism is booming and as the new hotshot travel agent stationed on the moon — the solar system’s most famous travel hub — you are tasked with the vital mission of getting tourist robots to their choice of interplanetary destinations quickly and safely.

Robots & Rockets is a competitive card game of interplanetary tourism for 2 to 4 players. The goal is to have the highest number of robots in your rocket fleet at the end of the game.

The game is played in turn by players taking the following actions: play a special action (optional) and allocate robots (mandatory). Players draw back up to 5 at the end of their turn.

Rockets remain docked until all of the seats are filled. The player who fills the remaining seat gets to claim the rocket and its passengers.

The game ends when the robot deck is depleted and players take turns placing remaining playable Robot cards they have in their hand.

The player with the fewest sum (Robot and Rocket cards) of cards claimed takes first pick at a Planet Contract, with the player with the most sum of cards picking last. The player with the most robots going to their chosen contract's planet is the winner.

182541.description:
In the shadows of Gotham City… Is the Riddler planning his next crime? Who has discovered Batman’s identity? Will the Joker Escape from Arkham Asylum?

With Rory’s Story Cubes®: Batman, you decide the story.

Roll all 9 StoryCubes to create infinite tales featuring your favourite Batman villains, gadgets and locations.

Rory’s Story Cubes®: Batman will inspire even more story tellers by partnering with one of our all time favourite characters, Batman. He is one of the world’s most famous superheroes, loved by all ages and now fans can create their very own Batman stories
182541.name: Rory's Story Cubes: Batman
boardgamepodcastepisode: 12 – The Family Gamers Podcast – The “Crate-y” Holiday Season
MOBG podcast 39 This is the Real Deal, Part 2 of Spiel Essen
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 62!!!

182542.name: Skilltree Saga
182542.description:
Skilltree Saga is the first Rogue-like RPG set in Aventuria - the world of The Dark Eye. Choose to play as human, elf or dwarf and battle randomly generated opponents in over 100 stages, developing a set of magical, enhanceable skills.

Source: The Publisher Website.

182543.name: All About Town: The Game of Louisville
182543.description:
From the rulebook:

The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a residence square to the bank and shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with the travel cards for all locations contained on his shopping list wins the game!

182544.description: Advanced Song of Blades and Heroes re-implements Song of Blades and Heroes and is identical to Fightin' Funghi except that the the fungus specific abilities have been removed. It builds on Song of Blades and Heroes by adding a more complex system for magic use and some other additional elements.
182544.name: Advanced Song of Blades and Heroes

182545.name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Fokker E.V
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War
182545.description:
From the publisher:

The Fokker E.V was a German monoplane fighter aircraft designed by Reinhold Platz and built by Fokker-Flugzeugwerke.

The E.V was the last Fokker design to become operational with the Luftstreitkräfte, entering service in the last months of World War I. After several fatal accidents due to wing failures, the aircraft was modified and redesignated Fokker D.VIII, and it had the distinction of scoring the last aerial victory of the war. It was flown by famous aces such as Erich Lowenhardt, Theodor Osterkamp and Karl Sharon.

Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW1 Wings of Glory® Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards.

182546.name: Hammer and Forge
182546.description:
Hammer and Forge is an expansion for Advanced Song of Blades and Heroes or for Fightin' Fungi (the two rule sets are identical except that Fightin' Fungi has additional rules specific to fungus creatures).

Hammer and Forge provides additional rules, background and profiles for the Dwarf race and its allies and enemies.

The Hammer and Forge supplement was originally released through a Kickstarter campaign which also funded the production of a line of miniatures (primarily Dwarves), but as is standard in the Song of Blades and Heroes system, players can use whatever miniatures they prefer or have on hand.

182547.name: Themewords
182547.description: A crossword game in which up to four players build word grids on a grid of coloured squares bearing preprinted letters. Each word must match a pre-determined theme and points are scored for word length with bonuses for matching letters on the board and for starting a word on the player's colour.

182548.name: Wolfenstein: The Old Blood
videogamehonor: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Expansion of the Year Winner
2015 Global Game Awards Best Shooter of the Year Nominee
182548.description:
User Summary

Wolfenstein: The Old Blood is a standalone expansion to Wolfenstein: The New Order. It too is a first person shooter, set in an alternate reality in or following WW-II, where the Nazis conquer the world.

The game again features William "B.J." Blazkowicz as protagonist and is a prequel The New Order.

The story starts with Blazkowicz and another secret agent infiltrating Castle Wolfenstein to get a top secret folder containing the location of General Wilhelm "Deathshead" Strass, the antagonist you're trying to eliminate in the first part of Wolfenstein: The New Order.

182549.description: Far from the battlefields of Europe and North Africa, Allied forces fought a very different war against another foe, from the jungles of Burma to the islands of the Pacific and the shores of Australia. This new Theatre Book for Bolt Action allows players to command the spearhead of the lightning Japanese conquests in the East or to fight tooth and nail as Chindits, US Marines and other Allied troops to halt the advance and drive them back. Scenarios, special rules and new units give players everything they need to recreate the ferocious battles and campaigns of the Far East, from Guadalcanal to Okinawa, Singapore, the Philippines, Iwo Jima and beyond.
182549.name: Bolt Action: Empires In Flames

182550.name: Bolt Action: Germany Strikes! – Early War in Europe
182550.description:
In 1939, Germany shattered the peace of Europe with a lightning-fast strike against Poland. The next year, it captured Denmark and Norway, before launching its famous Blitzkrieg against France, Belgium and The Netherlands. In less than two years of fighting, Nazi Germany became the master of mainland Europe.

This new Theatre Book for Bolt Action allows players to command armies of German tanks driving across the continent or to lead the desperate defense of the outgunned Allied armies. New scenarios, special rules and units give players everything they need to recreate the devastating battles and campaigns of the early war in Europe, including the fall of Poland, the breaking of the Maginot Line and the dramatic retreat to Dunkirk.

182551.description:
With Duel in the Sun, players can take command of the doughty Desert Rats of Montgomery's Eighth Army, the fast-moving and hard-hitting raiders of the Long Range Desert Group (LRDG), or Rommel's mighty Afrika Korps to recreate some of the most iconic battles of World War II--Operations Compass, Crusader and Torch, Tobruk, and Alamein among others.

Offering scenarios, special rules, and new troop types, this theater book for Bolt Action also takes players across the Mediterranean from North Africa, where they can follow the Italian Campaign from the invasion of Sicily, through the battles for Anzio and Cassino, to the final assaults on the Gothic Line.
182551.name: Bolt Action: Duel In The Sun – The African And Italian Campaigns

182552.name: Mara und der Feuerbringer: Das Kartenspiel
182552.description:
"The world threatens to sink into the dark and everything still between her and Ragnarok, the Twilight of the Gods, is, you are. Uses as your visionary skills, transgress with the gods in contact and find them, to bring them back to their homeland. Yet all is not lost! But be careful, the gods do not act entirely altruistic. They will try to influence you with deceit and cunning to get at your rune stones and fight hostile gods. Help your clan to strengthen their claim to the throne of Asgard and place the world order restored-because everything depends on you."

With Mara und der Feuerbringer: Das Kartenspiel ("Mara and the Fire Bringer: The Card Game") you embark into the mystical world Maras and the Nordic Germanic mythology. 2-4 players are stalwarts and assume the role of a Spákona and try to stop Ragnarok and to help their respective clan to the throne of Asgard.

Each player tries to collect the most victory point with his cards on the table, victory points stack and rune stones.

Victory points can be gained by playing your own authority cards, but also by stealing opponent cards and rune stones.

The game ends as soon as the first player has 14 victory points.

Players begin with playing their first mythological place open. Afterwards, each player in turn takes on one of the four stacks in the middle of the table, chooses three more cards in hand (without changing the order of cards in the stack) and then puts back these. Now, each player has five cards in his hand and a mythological place in front of him. It is not allowed to have more than 5 cards in hand. This hand limit, however, can be increased by certain card abilities.

The game is played as round clockwise. Each turn consists of four phases:

1. Energy Phase
2. Expansion phase
3. Action & Combat Phase
4. Draw cards

182553.name: Trade Wars
182553.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first ships of the season have braved the winter storms to arrive in Ancient Port. However, they remain anchored in the bay, despite being obviously laden with tradegoods. Something is wrong and the city is hiring heroes to investigate. Will the party discover the plot behind the mystery ships? Will they be able to stop the destruction of Ancient Port?

Designed for any level of heroes and any system with minimal preparation.

182554.name: Mutated Marine Minion & The Kraken (Supers!)
182554.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mutated Marine Minion is one of the loyal foot soldiers to the salt walter villain known as the Sea Monster (see WMW 5) who claims to be sent by the ocean itself to punish mankind for all it has done to her.

They are ready to cause briney mayhem in your SUPERS! game either alongside Sea Monster or freelancing on their own...

182555.name: Dr. Siren (Supers!)
182555.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dr. Siren is the companion and second-in-command of the salt water supervillain known as the Sea Monster (see World's Most Wanted #05: Sea Monster (Supers!)) who claims to be sent by the ocean itself to punish mankind.

The “Siren Song” of her Mind Control power is addictive, and serves to keep the Sea Monster’s minions loyal even when they are not being directly controlled. She also uses her power to ensure that she and Sea Monster have all of the ocean’s natural life forms at their disposal.

182556.description:
The Great Daimyo of the Ninja Clans has died in mysterious circumstances, just as it happened with his predecessor, and his predecessor’s predecessor, and so on so forth back to immemorial times. In order to take his place and serve the Shogun, the Daimyos of each clan have started the choosing process, and yes, you are said Daimyos. If you want to become the next Great Daimyo, you only need to manage one thing: Be the last survivor.

During your turn in Shinobi Assasins, you must attack the three rivals on your right, giving each of them an attack card face down. As you do so, you must tell each of them which weapon you're attacking them with — but of course this DOESN’T have to be TRUE. Remember, we’re Ninjas. Upon receiving the face-down attack, the assaulted player must mark the kind of attack he’s been told to be receiving by placing a black cube on top of the appropriate weapon icon on the back of the card. If a player has already received two identical attacks from other ninjas, be they true or not, you cannot repeat the same attack a third time.

When you attack, you can say whatever you want and gesticulate frantically or subtly wink to another player, anything you deem necessary to confuse them as to which attack you’re really assigning. Remember, deceit will be your most powerful weapon. Once you’ve assigned three of your ninjas to attack your rivals, the following player will do the same.

Once all the players have assigned their attacks, each of you will have before you three face-down attack cards, courtesy of the loving clans to your left. Each card will have a cube marking the weapon the attacking ninja is supposedly using. The time has come to use intuition, dodge and denounce.
182556.name: Shinobi Assassins

182557.name: The Druid
182557.description:
From publisher blurb:

You can feel the pulse of the world as it beats through the ground, and hear its sibilant whispers carried by the winds. You can channel this energy to heal those deserving few, or unleash it upon any who would defy the forces of nature.

Blurring the line between man and beast, you can also shed your own flesh, assuming the shape of one of nature’s myriad children. Your form is boundless: prowl through dark forests, soar through the open sky, and swim in the vast seas.

Armed with knowledge of the wild and its primeval power, do you simply try to survive, coexist with the kingdoms men strive to carve out for themselves, or will you drag civilization back into the untamed darkness?

Survival of the fittest, and all that that entails.

The class presents an alternative to the druid class found in Dungeon World. For starters, you don't roll to change your form, and you don't spend hold and revert back. Instead you choose a benefit and penalty. Another key difference is that you also have access to a few magical tricks.

As you level up, you choose where you improve: master your forms by gaining passive benefits and make more choices, enhance your healing, or devastate your enemies with primeval magic. You can also learn new tricks, like finding resources any time you venture through the wild, attract animal followers, and more.

The Director's Cut provides extensive detail on the skin-walker move, and ways to tweak both it and the core druid (such as by removing shapechanging entirely, focusing more on magic).

This product contains four files.

Two are letter-sized character sheets that use our new character sheet layout. One has a complete blank gear section, while the other fills in the initial choices if you want to just check some boxes and start playing.

The other two are digest-sized books, one in color, the other in black and white (to make it easier to print off at home if you want). They both contain:

The druid class, complete with 22 advanced moves.
New weapons, armor, and dungeon gear.
A pair of new magic items.
A director's cut with questions to ask yourself, explanations and suggestions for some of the moves (especially skin-walker), and some extra moves that didn't make the original cut (including some to further modify skin-walker, as well as ritual magic and ritual sacrifice).

182558.name: Svázaný Rukojemníkov
182558.description:
From publisher blurb:

Svázaný Rukojemníkov (Bound Hostage) is a story roleplaying game about life in a shell-shocked city of historical merit, caught between two warring armies. The front line of the battle has shifted back and forth through the city numerous times, leaving the townspeople to be rescued by one army, only to have the city invaded and occupied by the opposing force in a recapitulation months later. With no end to the bloody war in sight, the city has become a refuge for those who traffic illicit goods, while its citizens trudge through their shattered lives, bearing the final cost. The only constant is war.

Protocol is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters together into dramatic situations. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start points, characters, and finales. Players take on the roles of directors outside the action and characters inside the action, using the ebb and flow of four different scene-framing styles (vignettes, interrogations, interludes, and ensembles) to tell meaningful stories about characters in crisis.

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players. The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

182559.name: An Average Wild West Town
182559.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a fan of the Old West and would love to run an RPG set in a Western Town? Have you had problems finding floor plans to use? Well then, welcome to Whistle Reach Junction! This nice little Western Town is sure to please!

Fabled Environments' An Average Wild West Town gives you several buildings and a streetscape so you can build your own little slice of Western heaven!

The map pack includes:

Two-Story Settlers Cabin
Sherrif's Office
Church w/ small cemetery
Schoolhouse
Livery Stable
Hotel/Saloon
General Store
and a Streetscape that brings the little town to life.




All of these structures are presented with a variety of layers that you can turn on and off such as a 5' grid or hex, lables, furniture and even walls. Each map is presented in Black & White in a traditional floor plan style and is produced by an interior designer/archetectural drafter using AutoCAD.

182560.name: The 998th Conclave of Wizards
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
182560.description:
From the rear cover:

Hail, wizard of Aereth! Forget everything you think you know about the magic. Mastery of the occult lies beyond the comprehension of your world’s primitive societies and warring kingdoms. Your cantrips and legerdemain are mere parlor tricks in the face of true power. The Star Cabal, peerless practitioners of the arcane arts, extends a rare invitation to join their ranks. Hurtling through the cosmos in a marvelous flying city, the magicians are revered as lords of creation by the spacefaring races of a thousand suns. Ascend to the stars and seize your rightful seat in the vaunted halls of power… if you dare.

182561.description: A compilation of Munchkin Cthulhu, Munchkin Cthulhu 2 and Munchkin Cthulhu 3, along with 4 unique Dutch cards.
182561.name: Munchkin Koethulhu

182562.name: Dust Tactics: Kampfgruppe Von Stein
182562.description:
The BlutKreuz Korps has arrived in the Middle East! Along with the rest of Operation Babylon's forces, the dreaded Korps is now fighting the Allies and the SSU in this part of the World.

Content of the box:

one zombie hero: Frank Von Stein
one squad of five zombies, the Braineaters
one Heinrich (Trop) walker with a zombie pilot
one rule booklet with the introductions rules to Dust Tactics
twelve Axis Dust dice
one tank trap
one ammo crate
one gaming mat
six terrain tile
one catalog
3 unit cards
and one leaflet

182563.name: Dust Tactics: Taskforce Tanya
182563.description:
The Mercenaries have arrived in the Middle East! Operation Babylon fierce battles have called for the extensive use of Mercenary forces, fighting alongside, or against, any other bloc in the region.

Content of the box:

one hero: Tanya
one squad of five Sisters of Demolition
one Wrecker walker with a pilot
one rule booklet with the introductions rules to Dust Tactics
twelve Mercenary Dust dice
one tank trap
one ammo crate
one gaming mat
six terrain tile
one catalog
3 unit cards
and one leaflet

182564.name: The Sorcerer's Tome
182564.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Swords & Wizardry Mini-Dungeon
For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 3-5

The minions of an evil sorcerer terrorize the city streets at night. Efforts made to find the sorcerer’s lair have failed. Of course no one’s thought to look for it inside a book...

The Sorcerer’s Tome is part of a series of mini-dungeons designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side quests or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

182565.name: Pleasure Den (Pathfinder)
182565.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4-6 Characters of Levels 7-8

Venture into this pleasure den where nymphs await the arrival of your party. You will be well taken care of and become so relaxed you just may drift off to a peaceful slumber.... ZZZZZ

182566.name: The Aura of Profit (Pathfinder)
182566.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4-6 Characters of Level 1

The Aura of Profit takes place in an underground lair that serves as an alchemical laboratory. Fritz is an alchemist who has an underground laboratory in the poor section of the city. His experiments produce wastes that run into the sewer and enhance the effects of alcohol. Several local innkeepers have seen sales plummet, as their patrons can’t hold their liquor anymore. They think that there is something happening underground, where a strange odor has been detected under one of the taverns. They have asked the PCs to investigate.

182567.name: Universal Adventures Adventure Module #7: Tombs of Terror
182567.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Beyond the blue chamber and the hall of the vulture-headed things stand the doors emblazoned with the visage of the great demon’s head. And beyond that, the Tombs of Terror...”

Go in search of legendary treasure within the Tombs of Terror! Tombs of Terror is the 7th adventure in the Adventure Module series and includes a new Adventure Record, 9 Adventure cards, 9 Encounter cards, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards, 18 Treasure cards, and 18 custom area cards. Also included is a free set of 9 Sarcophagus cards! Face deadly monsters, devious traps and more in this all new dungeon adventure.

Suitable for use with any fantasy role playing game, and playable solo or with a group, with or without a GM, Tombs of Terror, brings you a fun and exciting adventure you’ll be able to play again and again. The Universal Adventures Adventure Module is a new, simple way to play fantasy adventures. The organization and presentation of the adventures allows for quick setup, quick play and gives you material you can use again and again. Enter a new and exciting world of adventure, full of wonder and surprises.

182568.name: Sectors Forty-Two & Forty-Three
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
182568.description:
From publisher blurb:

The exploration of "Deep Space" begins.

These sectors are home to many Julahmo colonies, and of course, wherever the Julahmo go, the Ernya and the Khruntha are sure to follow. There's a lot of unexplored areas, and only partially explored areas, plus there are a lot of mysteries waiting for brave...or foolish explorers.

182569.name: SoB Stories #2: Live Nude Girls
182569.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Nah, nah, I'm serious. I heard it straight from a friend who works for her. I never woulda believed it myself but sure as anything. Goes to show you never ever truly know anybody.

"Especially someone like Queenie.”

The ladies of Bricktown have enjoyed relative peace since Queenie ascended the throne. But somebody in town has taken some fungirls hostage and is using them as leverage to get something from the head Valkyrie. Something she's not eager to part with.

This PDF is a standalone scenario for use as a one-shot or to placed inside your ongoing Streets of Bedlam campaign.

182570.name: The Arrangement
182570.description:
From publisher blurb:

War Stories: The Arrangement is a transmedia setting enhancement for Contagion Second Edition

The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place. On the surface, it looks much like the world you and I live in. Just beneath that surface, in the shadows, rages an ancient conflict between supernatural factions who all seek dominion over the Earth and control over the souls of humanity. Supernatural creatures stalk the night, hiding among, and sometimes hunting, humans.

In recent months a group of demons, the Mastim, have shifted their approach to collecting human souls. While the majority of the Mastim caste seeks worship through the use of false gods, the recent return of the Ilu has led to brutal conflict inspiring some of the more forward-thinking Mastim to change their approach to seeking followers. This small group of Mastim, known as the “Sales Department,” has abandoned the standard M.O. of the Mastim in favor of directly marketing damnation to the human masses.

War Stories: The Arrangement focuses on one such deal, where the demon Gallu seeks to finalize a pact with a desperate human woman, Sheri Bronson. Tragedy has touched Sheri’s life and she pins all her hopes on Gallu to resolve her problems. Naturally, Gallu offers his aid, but for a very steep price.

War Stories: The Arrangement includes:

A 17 page setting enhancement detailing two new feats and two adventure seeds.
Biographical information and pregenerated character sheets for the two new characters featured in War Stories: The Arrangement.
A short film/video asset to be used as an in-game prop/story aid by the Gamemaster.

182571.name: Solar Echoes MC Screen
182571.description:
From publisher blurb:

This fast-moving sci-fi RPG just became faster!

Enjoy the first official GM Screen for Solar Echoes! We call the GM a Mission Controller (MC) and with this referee screen, running a mission will be even easier. The tables MC's use the most are presented clearly on the 3 inside panels, with rules covering character conditions, combat actions, damage types, weapon range penalties, and even that elusive grenade-bounce diagram!

The 3 outside panels include the cover art from the Player's Guide, the Mission Controller's Guide, and the work of our newest artist, John Fell! Step onto an alien planet with a new team of Union Guard agents that is ready for anything. Maybe your character type is among them!

182572.name: Light Cutter
182572.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 48 x 30 inch, two level, full color floorplan of a Light Cutter.

It comes with Square, Hex and No Ovelays and includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play).

The Light Cutter is a redesign of The Raven Airship as a water ship model. The Light Cutter includes the remodeled upper deck for sea travel and a lower slave pen deck for transporting slaves recycled from The Raven Airship. By redesigning the upper deck with a lower page count and removing the lower cargo deck, this reduces the cost of a print on demand version of this product (which will be available after proofing). If you need a print on demand merchant ship with a cargo hold, River Barge can suit your needs.

The Light Cutter is intended for use in blackpowder fantasy and pirate settings as it is armed with four cannons. The slave pen lower deck is used to transport slaves or criminals making it a target for pirates who may or may not know slaves are on board, figuring it to be a cargo vessel, liberators who believe in freedom for all men and pushed by conscience to act on their beliefs, or criminals trying to free their friends from the law.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Cutting across the Ocean: The light cutter is running slaves across the ocean in dangerous shipping lanes full of pirates. The group can be hired as guards on the ship who need to fend off these pirates. If they didn’t know the “cargo” was slaves they may even plan to mutiny against the merchant that hired them.

When pirates attack the ship, the adventurers need to decide whether to abide by the contract they signed with the merchant and protect the ship or parley with the pirates and attempt to switch sides.

The group could also be playing as the pirates instead, expecting a cargo hold full of trade goods and find out the “cargo” is slaves. They could also be liberators trying to free the slaves or criminals trying to bust their friends out of incarceration.

If the slaves are freed, they could be criminals who then try to take over the ship. They could play nice instead and be dropped off on shore by their liberators. Then the group hears rumors of escaped convicts committing atrocious crimes.

The adventurers may even be hired to investigate these crimes and then come face-to-face with the people that they freed, monsters that they let loose upon the world a second time. The criminals recognize them and tell them that they will let them go without harm, a favor for a past favor. The group can slink away or they can choose to put a stop to these criminals and return them to their original fate.

182573.description: This first expansion to Treasure Hunter adds new Treasure Tiles, interesting new Hero Cards, tougher goblins, and Dog Cards to chase those pesky goblins off!
182573.name: Treasure Hunter Expansion 1: Goblin's Loot

182574.name: Road Kill
182574.description:
From publisher blurb:

ROAD KILL!

Once a race car driver on the rise, his career crashed after he attempted to end another driver's life. Undergoing an experiment while imprisoned, he found himself able to move at incredible speeds. Calling himself Road Kill, he's back in the race and ready to take on your heroes!

182575.name: The Enchanted Kingdom
182575.description:
From publisher blurb:

You've discovered an enchanted realm! You're visiting your aunt in England. One day you leave her cottage to go exploring and discover a mysterious cluster of hills. You decide to return that night to secretly investigate them. When you get there, you're amazed to see a crowd of strange, beautiful people dancing in the moonlight. You've stumbled upon the court of the Fair Folk from Elfland.

182576.name: The Antimatter Formula
182576.description:
From publisher blurb:

Both of your parents are physicists dabbling in antimatter experiments. One morning, you wake up, and all is quiet. Too quiet.

182577.name: Vanished!
182577.description:
From publisher blurb:

You and your friends Tony and Andrea set off in search of another friend, Jill, who has vanished in the Bermuda Triangle.

182578.name: Volcano!
182578.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are determined to find a legendary silver sword hidden in a Hawaiian volcano.

182579.name: Seaside Mystery
182579.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you dare learn the secret of the lost mermaid?

You're spending the summer at a seaside boardinghouse. One moonlit night you hear someone crying on the beach. You peek out your window — and see a mermaid named Tana. You'd like to help her, but she's in a terrible mood. "I don't know where the rest of the mermaids are," she snaps. "I've been looking for two days, but I can't find any of them. And if you want to hear any more, you'll have to follow me underwater!"

182580.name: Secret of the Sun God
182580.description:
From publisher blurb:

You travel to Mexico to help your aunt Eloisa find a legendary temple.

182581.description:
From the publisher:

Super Hazard Quest is a card game inspired by vintage video game side-scrollers. That is, it’s designed to look, feel and actually play like a nintendo classic.

As with most video games, the goal is to defeat a “FINAL BOSS”. But with every hero aiming for the same goal, only one can actually go home with the glory. Players will battle against both in-game enemies and each other as they race to the final battle.

Giant “QUEST” cards make up the board of Super Hazard Quest. Each card features a unique room in the adventure, complete with obstacles (or HAZARDS) that stand in a hero’s way. “ITEM” cards, along with each hero’s innate ability help them navigate from card to card. Whenever an unexplored part of the Quest is reached, a new Quest card is drawn from the deck and connected. Thus, the level builds as the heroes explore.

Hidden among the Quest cards are boss rooms, including the game’s Final Boss. But ordinary Items won’t be enough. A SECRET CODE, well protected by other bosses, is the only weakness of the game’s Final Boss. That said, heroes must first find a Boss, earn a Code and then be the first to reach the Final Boss. It’s all the fun of multi-player retro gaming without ever having to blow into a cartridge!

We are live on kickstarter: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/949523363/super-hazard-...
182581.name: Super Hazard Quest

182582.name: Yokai: Yamata No orochi
182582.description:
Yokai: Yamata No Orochi is the first expansion for the card game Yokai. This expansion add more white cards and the new black Yokai, a new type of cards that give negative points to the players.
The expansion add also a new game modality, the "Orochi Challenge", in this modality all the special powers of the cards and the points value are nullified, the goal of the players is to not make a tricolor trio and make or a monocolor trio for empty the board.

When a player make a tricolor trio, he must draw one of the nine cards that are on the board, in a case of a stall all the players draw a card, if the card is black the player was eliminated.

182583.name: Rock and Roll Mystery
182583.description:
From publisher blurb:

You're the leader of a promising new band, but before you can enter stardom, you'll need to rescue two of your members from kidnappers.

182584.name: Invaders of the Planet Earth
182584.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ten years ago, the Earth was invaded by aliens who disabled all of the planet's electricity due to their own vulnerabilities. You have decided to somehow find a way to free the Earth's population and restore power to the world.

182585.name: Space Vampire
182585.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a recent Elite-level graduate of the Space Academy, and your first mission involves a near-invincible alien vampire!

182586.name: Planet of the Dragons
182586.description:
From publisher blurb:

When your spaceship accidentally lands on Tambor, you discover that the inhabitants of this distant planet are being terrorized by fire-breathing dragons. In order to restore peace, you must vanquish the dragons once and for all--if you choose your actions correctly!

182587.name: The Mona Lisa is Missing!
182587.description:
From publisher blurb:

The reader's success at solving cases involving art theft has earned international recognition. So when the famous Mona Lisa is stolen from the Louvre, the French Surete puts the reader in charge of the case!

182588.name: The Cow Dice Game
182588.description: Players roll six-sided dice numbered 2-6 with a cow symbol replacing the one. Summing dice and doubling the score for each cow. Only even-numbers count. On each turn the player may roll up to 3 times, setting aside dice on each roll.

182589.name: Cat and Mouse (Pathfinder)
rpgseries: Southlands: Adventures Beneath the Pitiless Sun
182589.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who Do You Trust?

In the cool streets and blazing bazaars, the word is out: a great treasure has gone missing in the Everlasting City of the Cat, and some very ambitious people have set their sights on it. Many paws and claws are out, and everyone is sniffing around for something rich and strange.

It’s an odd time for a catfolk thief and a gnoll merchant to make very tempting offers to strangers in town. Or, perhaps it’s not odd at all. Get caught up in the hunt with Cat and Mouse by Richard Pett, the acclaimed Paizo adventure path author!

This Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 1st-level characters is a perfect introduction to the Southlands campaign setting, and it fits neatly into any desert city where cats are sacred and rats are cautious and sly.

182590.name: The Nebula From Hell
182590.description:
The Nebula From Hell is a party game for people who enjoy laughing at and being laughed at by others. It is meant to be played with crazy, sarcastic people who enjoy making fun of other people. This game has it all. Nebulas, dragons, canoes, bombs, wizards, stars, action cards, bonus cards, physical challenges, and boats. What more could you want from a game?

This game actually hates you. Most games try to entertain you. This game wants to crush your skull. Just when you think you're winning, you'll be sucked into the Nebula and spit out with nothing. Game over. Go home, loser.

Who is this game for? For those who prey on the weak and laugh and jeer as they kick them while they're down. If you have any emotional response at all in life, this game probably isn't for you.

Easy to play. Hard to win. On your turn, drawn an action card. Read it out loud. Do what it says. That's it.

182591.name: Bota Abaixo
182591.description:
From the publisher:

Bota Abaixo is your new card game!

Four friends, inebriated by another tedious evening decided to look for the cure for boredom creating this amazing game.

With this game you will finally find a way out of those awkward silences on stuck-up events. Bota Abaixo is the solution to turn the most monotonous of parties into a cascade of good vibe!

Bota Abaixo is the game that can’t miss to liven up your parties!

Based on the most popular drinking games as Ring of Fire or Kings, Bota Abaixo is more than a game, it’s an appealing and singular object which allows you to play, have fun and collect.
PLAY TO THE LAST DROP !!

HOW TO PLAY:

The players get around the cards in circle and the cards are randomly put in the middle face down. Playing clockwise each round a player picks one card which will have one specific rule wich the player make something (usually drinking a swig). At the end of each round the cards are discarded with the exception for the WC and immunity cards which can be kept. The game is played until there are no more cards.

You can play in the Competition mode in which each player can only refill his glass one time and are eliminated as soon as they drink it. The game is when until there is only one winner "standing".

There are various cards as Cascade; Make up one Rule; They Drink; Rime vs Rime...

Note: To play this game the use of alcoholic drinks is NOT mandatory.

Description in Portuguese:

Quatro amigos com jeito para a ilustração, inebriados por mais um serão enfadonho resolveram procurar a cura para o aborrecimento. E foi assim que de lápis na mão e de copo na beiça criaram o Bota Abaixo!

Baseado nos mais populares drinking games como Ring of Fire ou Kings, e ilustrado duma ponta à outra em 56 divertidas cartas, Bota Abaixo é o jogo que não pode faltar para animar as tuas festas!

Com Bota Abaixo vais conseguir quebrar o gelo naqueles convívios chatos onde apenas se trocam olhares macambúzios. É a tua solução para transformar a mais monótona das festas numa cascata de boa disposição!

JOGA ATÉ À ÚLTIMA GOTA!!

182592.name: Hurricane!
182592.description:
From publisher blurb:

You're a treasure hunter, searching fora man who's missing at sea, when you are kidnapped and taken to the laboratory of a scientist called "Dr. Hurricane". Evil Dr. Hurricane can create storms at will, and he wants you to help him attack the world's largest cities. How will you save yourself--and the world--from destruction?

182593.description:
One day, in the past, the civilized world stood in the brink of destruction. The Soviet superpower pointed dangerously their missiles towards the north-american superpower, triggering a crisis that threatened the existence of mankind. It was 1962.

In some parallel universe, however, that crisis never ended. Centuries have passed. In secret, terrible killing machines have been developed by both sides. And the time has come that a new arms race may end the world... or devote his side the winner!

In Deterrence 2X62, your objective is to win the cold war by destroying the enemy country through a single successful attack, or dominating the richness of the world.

During the match, the players can play construction cards in their cities to strengthen their defenses and threaten the enemy cities or play cards as treaties, to avoid enemy attacks. These constructions have Missiles, Anti-missiles, Commands, Treaties, Range and Money, that allows the player who match those resources in the best possible way, be the great winner!
182593.name: Deterrence 2X62

182594.name: Track of the Bear
182594.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are the descendent of a long-lost Arctic explorer, and when you hear that a movie is going to be made about his more famous and successful rival, you decide that it's time to find out what really happened all those years ago....

182595.name: You Are a Monster
182595.description:
From publisher blurb:

The reader is kidnapped by an evil scientist, taken to his laboratory and transformed into a monster! Can the reader find a way to reverse the fiendish experiment--or remain a monster forever? The reader's choices decide his or her fate!

182596.name: Knights of the Round Table
182596.description:
From publisher blurb:

During a visit to a medieval-themed shop, you are given an opportunity to truly experience some of the adventure you have been reading about for so long...

182597.name: Master of Kung Fu
182597.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your friend Billy has been studying kung fu. Although you haven't been studying it, you still get to travel to China with him on a class trip. When you get to China, though, Billy disappears!

182598.name: South Pole Sabotage
182598.description:
From publisher blurb:

On board the "Pole Star" to investigate ozone depletion over the South Pole, a series of decisions by the reader may mean the success or failure of the mission.

182599.name: Mutiny in Space
182599.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a mutiny occurs on your space vessel, you need to choose which side you will fight for!

182600.name: Jagt den Koffer-Mann
182600.description:
This game was adapted from the british TV-series "Man in a Suitcase" (Der Mann mit dem Koffer) from 1967.

The players have to reach the safe in the center of the game board with their agent. Movement is determined by a die. If a Agent gets on an orange space, he advances according to the printed arrow. On a red or yellow space the player has to draw a card to hinder or benefit his agent. if he rolls a six he doesn't move, but has to drop the glass marble into the slot. Any agent that gets hit by the marble has to return to the starting space. The player who drops the marble has the option to remove his agent from the board and return it after the marble has run it's course. However if he chooses to remain on the board and his agent isn't hit, he advances a number of spaces, according to the compartment, where the marble comes to rest. The first player to reach the safe wins the game.

182603.name: Stalag 17
182603.description:
User Summary

Your countrymen have been captured by the enemy, and it's up to you to help them escape. Other countries are trying to break their men out, and the more prisoners that make it, the tighter security becomes. Sacrificing stealth for speed isn't always the answer though.

boardgameintegration: The Princess Bride: Prepare to Die
The Princess Bride: Prepare to Die
182604.description:
A party game in which players fill in the famous phrase "Hello. My name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die."' with ridiculous names and activities.

You might say to yourself, "but wait, this game already exists!" and you would nearly be right ... but actually wrong.

Prepare to Die! Again!! is the exact same game as Prepare to Die, but with different cards.
182604.name: The Princess Bride: Prepare to Die! Again!!

182605.description: In Skyliners, players collectively build buildings and skyscrapers in a shared building plot, with each player trying to satisfy bets they've made as to which buildings they'll be able to see in the five rows of buildings on their side of the playing area.
182605.name: Skyliners
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2015 - Hans im Gluck
Skyliners (Hans im Glück): Spiele-Podcast Nr. 273

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
182606.name: Chasm of the Faceless King
rpgitemversion: First Printing, Gary Con VII  Special Limited Edition
182606.description:
From the back cover:

ESCAPE THE CHASM OR DIE!

Death is on your heels, seekers! Whilst delving the awesome depths of a fantastic dungeon complex, your party have foolishly awakened an entity of limitless power and destruction: Xxubleks, otherwise known as "The Faceless King" or "The Lord of Slime". If you wish to survive, you must presently find your way out of this hellish dungeon. The demon has assumed the form of a massive, conical heap of slime, and it will not rest until you are destroyed. It is perhaps ten minutes behind you....

From the front cover:

An OSRIC mini-adventure designed for from four to six characters of 4th through 6th level.

Gary Con VII Special Edition, limited to 300 copies signed by Jeffrey Talanian.

182607.description: A cross game promotional character from Artistic Justice Game's Dragon Tides, Bruce Lee wields four 'follow-up attack cards' which he can ante on any given beat and represent a second attack he will make if his first attack connects. While a fairly straightforward character who can be shut down with careful play, Bruce Lee's barrage of attacks gives him explosive damage potential on every single beat if his combos manage to connect properly.
182607.name: BattleCON: Bruce Lee Promo

182608.description: Level 99 Games' official mascot character, Eliza has four fanciful genre cards which she can use when her attacks connect to add various effects to her attack pair. However, Eliza must be careful -- if she gets hit, her opponent can force her to discard a genre card, rendering it temporarily unusable. Eliza is a very tactical trickster style character, with a surprising amount of versatility and control over the battlefield.
182608.name: BattleCON: Eliza Promo

182609.description: BattleCON: Devastation's hidden secret bonus character, Anath Adrasteia represents the forces of Havoc come to wreak devastation across the land of Indines, in true easter-egg-secret-final-boss style. Anath wields four different stance-like aspect cards, one of which will always be active, which give her enormous passive stat bonus (and some penalties), which combine with her powerful but somewhat inflexible styles to turn her into stat monster worthy of being called a final boss.
182609.name: BattleCON: Anath Adrasteia Promo

182610.description: BattleCON: War's hidden secret bonus character, Evil Hikaru is the twisted and dark reflection of the hero Hikaru. With four evil elemental antes mirroring Hikaru's pure elemental tokens but with more insidious, offensive effects, combined with his incredibly powerful styles and unique base, Evil Hikaru makes for an excellent hidden easter egg secret bonus boss.
182610.name: BattleCON: Evil Hikaru Promo

182611.description: A cross game promotional character from Arcane Wonders' Mage Wars, Iskra Brimstone is a warlock who takes delight in setting her foes on fire. When Iskra successfully stuns her opponent she also sets them on fire for three turns, causing them to take damage over time and also supercharging many of her already aggressive styles.
182611.name: BattleCON: Iskra Brimstone Promo

182612.description: A cross game promotional character from Arcane Wonders' Mage Wars, Raederick Blackforge is a heavyweight fighter with four unique equipment cards he can forge for himself as the match goes on. These pieces of equipment, once made, grant Raederick permanent bonuses for the rest of the match, and can be sacrificed to give him huge temporary bonuses. With the help of his arms and armor, Raederick can transform himself from a run of the mill heavyweight into a veritable juggernaut!
182612.name: BattleCON: Raederick Blackforge Promo

182613.description: A cross game promotional character from Plaid Hat Games' Summoner Wars, Prince Elien is a tactical fighter who does battle by summoning and moving around a wall marker which both protects him from his opponent's attacks and also allows him to launch certain attacks of his own from its position. With a number of ways to place a literal wall of protection between him and his enemy and to safely attack them from behind cover, Prince Elien is a defensive force to be reckoned with.
182613.name: BattleCON: Prince Elien Promo

182614.description: A cross game promotional character from Jasco Games' Red Horizon, Vincent Grey gets the opportunity to guess his opponent's attack pair, getting a small but sizable bonus if he gets it half right and outright stunning his opponent if he is completely on the mark. This, along with his hard hitting and surprisingly versatile styles and unique base, makes Vincent both a heavyweight fighter and a predictor fighter -- a combination which should strike fear into the hearts of BattleCON players everywhere.
182614.name: BattleCON: Vincent Grey Promo

182615.description: A cross game promotional character from Jasco Games' Red Horizon, Nehtali is a ranged brawler with five unique dark deal cards with very sizable stat bonuses on them. During the ante phase, Nehtali may ante 2, 3, or all 5 of these dark deals by paying 0, 1, or 2 life, respectively, and then split the deals into two different stacks. Her opponent then chooses which stack to give Nehtali, giving her the bonuses of the deals in that stack. This unique mechanic combined with her high movement medium ranged styles turn Nehtali into a highly versatile and unpredictable brawler, capable of trapping her opponents into many different lose-lose situations they cannot easily escape from.
182615.name: BattleCON: Nehtali Promo

182616.description: A crossover promotional character created by Nokomento (Eunice Tiu) herself, Lucius is a build up brawler fighter with three shackle cards which all begin the game locked. Whenever Lucius stuns his opponent with an attack, he may choose to deal no damage to instead unlock one of his shackles, granting him a permanent stat boost for the rest of the game. This, combined with his trickery, slippery styles allow him to slowly build up power until he can crush his opponents with the combined onslaught of unpredictable attacks alongside sheer numerical superiority.
182616.name: BattleCON: Lucius Promo

182617.description: A crossover promotional character created by Fabio Fontes, Takeshi Kamikaze has a stash of eight different weapon cards which he cycles through as the match progresses, each giving him radically different stat bonuses and penalties.
