rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182825.description:
User summary

This is a free 1-page PDF file describing the the Catoblepas, a CR 4 monster.

182826.name: Gobliiins Trilogy
182826.description:
Gobliiins Trilogy is a compilation of the three first games in series by the same name. It's three puzzle games, all with a team of three different goblins, each with a unique skill.

The game are:

Gobliiins
Gobliins 2: The Prince Buffoon
Goblins Quest 3

182827.name: Gulon
rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182827.description:
User summary

This is a free 1-page PDF file describing the the Gulon, a CR 1 monster.

rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182828.name: Wondrous Objects #1
182828.description:
User summary

This is a free 1-page PDF file describing items for Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game.

Items: Ring of the Wolf, Gauntlet of Transformation

rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182829.name: Wondrous Objects #2
182829.description:
User summary

This is a free 1-page PDF file describing items for Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game.

Items: Thief's Dagger, Lens of Retro-Viewing Bag of Smoke

rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182830.name: Wondrous Objects #3
182830.description:
User summary

This is a free 1-page PDF file describing the Bottle of Curious Inebriation for Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game.

182831.description:
You have entered the dark, half-sunken ruins of Belegost in search of powerful artifacts and ancient treasure.

Inside the Dwarven city, you can feel an evil presence stalking you...

The Ruins of Belegost is an exciting new quest for The Lord of the Rings LCG, first introduced at the Lord of the Rings Fellowship Event at GenCon 2015.
182831.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Ruins of Belegost
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182832.name: Wondrous Objects #4
182832.description:
User summary

This is a free 1-page PDF file describing items for Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game.

Items: Yellow Fang, Jade Skull of Guarding, Brooch of Arachnophilia

rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182833.name: Wondrous Objects #5
182833.description:
User summary

This is a free 1-page PDF file describing items for Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game.

Items: The Moonshield, Jar of Storm Powder, Phial of Daylight

182834.description:
Family Guy: Stewie's Sexy Party Game is a hilarious, fast-paced word game of questionable social value...not really suitable for anyone. Spin the spinner! Earn martinis! Offend your friends and relatives!

Each round, a new player is Stewie, the host of the party. Stewie spins the spinner to determine the theme of the party and draws a party card. Stewie's guests help throw the party by offering word cards to fill in the blanks of the party card. Guests score martinis by collecting sets of Family Guy characters on their word cards; Stewie scores martinis when the guests agree that the completed party card matches the theme. When the booze runs out, the party is over and the player with the most martinis wins!
182834.name: Family Guy: Stewie's Sexy Party Game

182835.name: Love Season
182835.description:
From the designer:

Love Season is a card game about Little bunnies' love affairs.

In this game of chase you are a little bunny trying to go home but bunny girls find you so cute they won't let you go away.
For 3 to 6 players from 8 years old and up (works best with adults and teenagers ;) ), this game can take less than 20 min to play. It can go faster once you know it well and can end up in 5 min.

The rules :
Cards are divided in two categories. The one you can play during your turn for scoring, and the one you can play every time to any players, the bunny girls (attack) and the defensive cards to escape.

The first that reach 7 jump cards and reach a rabbit hole card win. But, while you jumping around, other player can send you bunnies that catch you and block your progression.

rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182836.name: The Worgork
182836.description:
User summary

This is a free 5-page PDF file describing the Worgork, a new race for Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game.

rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182837.name: The Bezgall
182837.description:
User summary

This is a free 3-page PDF file describing the Bezgall, a new race for Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game.

rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182838.name: The Zektoi
182838.description:
User summary

This is a free 2-page PDF file describing the Zektoi, a new race for Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game.

rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182839.name: The Horsehead
182839.description:
User summary

This is a free 3-page PDF file describing the Horsehead, a new centauroid race for Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game.

rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182840.name: Blackfork
182840.description:
User summary

This is a free 2-page PDF file describing Blackfork (Lizard Mage, CR 4), a nefarious NPC for Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game.

rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182841.name: Vandanna Night-Cloak
182841.description:
User summary

This is a free 1-page PDF file describing Vandanna Night-Cloak (Thief/Assassin/Scoundrel, CR3), a nefarious NPC for Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game.

rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182842.name: Divannis Queen-Claw
182842.description:
User summary

This is a free 2-page PDF file describing Divannis Queen-Claw (Witch/Hag, CR6), a nefarious NPC for Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game.

rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182843.name: Klersyx Gnawbones
182843.description:
User summary

This is a free 1-page PDF file describing Klersyx Gnawbones (Rogue/Ghost, CR3), a nefarious NPC for Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game.

rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
182844.name: Rahua Vish
182844.description:
User summary

This is a free 1-page PDF file describing Rahua Vish (Assassin/Mage, CR7), a nefarious NPC for Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game.

182845.description:
In Bad Habit, a player draws a card with three bad habits and chooses one. The other players ask questions and to find out what is the required bad habit. Questions must be simple. If your teammates guess your bad habit you get the card as a point. If your opposing team guess they get the point.

The team who has the most points is the winner.
182845.name: Bad Habit

182846.name: High Five
182846.description: In High Five, players seek five words on a given theme on the card you have drawn and write the words on a sheet of paper. The more players have written identical words found on this card, the more points you get. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

182847.name: Universal Adventures Flooded Tomb
182847.description:
From publisher blurb:

Splashes and rapid clicking echo off the stone walls as something huge and slimy bursts from the dark waters of the river.

Explore the Flooded Tomb, if you dare. Search for lost treasure amid the rubble and bones. But beware of what lurks in the dark waters of the nearby river and beyond the edge of your light. The first expansion pack for the newest Adventure Module, Tombs of Terror, Universal Adventures Flooded Tomb brings you 9 cards for use with the Flooded Tomb area from the Tombs of Terror adventure, or a similar area of your own choice. Add new depths of danger to your Universal Adventures with the Flooded Tomb!

182848.name: Samrat: Rise of The Delhi Sultanate
182848.description:
From the publisher's website:

Samrat is a board game that takes you back to 12th - 13th century medieval India. This is the time when Muhammad Ghori unravels his plans to take over India. India was ruled by Prithviraj Chauhan from Delhi and Raja Jaichand from Kannauj in the current state of Uttar Pradesh. To the west, Gujarat was under the rule of Raja Bhimdev II. While history notes the success story of how Muhammad Ghori defeats these kings, Samrat gives the players another chance to rewrite history.

Each player takes on the role of a king from medieval India and completes his objectives to earn stars. Some of these are based on true Indian history! Players build camps in their kingdoms to produce three types of resources - Gold, Stone and Wood. Use resources to raise an army and complete the identified objectives. The first player to earn five stars (2 players) or seven stars (3 or 4 players) wins the game.

182849.name: Space Cede
182849.description:
From publisher blurb:

The PCs are on their way to Seti Beta Seven to drop off a group of cybernetically enhanced criminals. On the way they are waylaid by solar storms, ship system malfunctions, and the criminals themselves. On top of this they only have about 48 hours to get to Seti Beta Seven. Can they get the criminals to Seti Beta Seven on time? Set in your captain seat, read the computer readout, and get ready to find out in this One Shot Adventure for the White Star role playing game.

Also included: The Officer class!!!

182850.name: The Sorceress of Zoom: Down to Earth
182850.description:
From publisher blurb:

"The Earth Plane Vexes Me! I Will Stand For It No Longer!"

The Sorceress of Zoom is the most powerful spellcaster on her homeworld. There are few sights that terrify populations more than her amazing cloud city appearing in the air above their homes -- for the sorceress is never denied what she wants, and others always pay the price. She is the deadliest of femme fatales, and she is turning her attention to the treasures of Earth!

The Sorceress of Zoom was a quirky fantasy series that appeared in the pages of Weird Comics during 1940 and 1941. Featuring the weirdest of weird fantasy, each installment saw her bringing to bear powerful magic to ward off all comers in pursuit of selfish and often horrific goals. It's a great example of the "anything goes" nature of the early Golden Age of Comics.

In addition to five classic tales of the Sorceress, The Sorceress of Zoom: Down to Earth contains feats, a talent tree, and other rules to bring Sorceress-style reality-style action to your OGL d20 System games; as well as game stats for the artifacts that grant their possessor mastery of Zoom, the Sorceress's flying city.

182851.name: Drake Mining and Manufacturing
182851.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Argo Galaxy is growing – not physically but figuratively. After years of study, the House of the Alliance has finally decided to open the Hastilion Expanse for full settlement and corporate utilization. Researchers identified numerous planets and moons as optimal for civilization and corporations from around the known galaxy, including Drake Mining and Manufacturing, are making plans to acquire land.

Since its inception, Drake Mining and Manufacturing has prided itself on mining resources and creating high-quality products from those resources to support the entire galaxy. Moving into the Hastilion Expanse provides them with a wealth of opportunities to expand their operations and grow their business. That is, of course, if their new facilities can survive.

New planets are always fraught with hidden dangers from native flora and fauna, pirates, rival corporations, and rebellious populations. Only the strength of Drake’s mercenary force will help them overcome any roadblocks and become successful. As long as they don’t get killed in the process.

Draking Mining and Manufacturing presents the primer of the Hastilion Expanse campaign for Mercenary Breed Savage Worlds or can be used as a standalone setting for new adventures and campaigns. Originally published in Savage Insider Premium and the Hastilion Expanse Compendiums, this new campaign setting updates the content to Mercenary Breed 2.0 and expands on the original content.

Drake Mining and Manufacturing includes:

An introduction to the Hastilion Expanse campaign.
A look at Drake Mining and Manufacturing
3 new character xeno templates.
A gazetteer of the Hastilion Expanse with 9 descriptive planets.
Mechanics for housing and vehicles pertaining to the campaign.

182852.name: Exiles of the Wicked Maze
182852.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Exiles Of The Wicked Maze, a complete traditional tabletop game for 1 player! This game is a sword and sorcery style quest in which you play a prisoner exiled to a massive labyrinth located below the vast, wicked city that you once called home. The basic rules are simple enough. Start at the entrance of the maze and work your way through to the ending point, collecting enough treasure to pay a fine of 5,000 coins as you go. Along the way you will encounter a variety of different symbols, most of these will require you to make a random roll on a chart or two. Some of these symbols will allow you to gain treasure, while others may require you to avoid a deadly trap or fight a monster. Your gained treasures and suffered wounds are recorded on a simple character sheet, which in some ways is similar to the character sheets that you would expect to find with a typical table top role playing game.

Unlike a typical table top role playing game, no “game master” is required. The encountered symbols and random roll charts dictate the challenges and treasures that you stumble upon. Unlike a typical table top board game, you draw your way through freshly printed copy of the maze rather than rolling dice and moving an equal number of spaces.

182853.name: Exiles Of The Wicked Maze: Dark Lust
182853.description:
From the Introduction:

Dark Lust is the first mini-expansion for Exiles Of The Wicked Maze. As indicated in the introduction story, the events of this mini-expansion occur roughly five years after the original timeline of the game. Many of the original foes have been replaced by tougher counterparts, making this expansion more challenging than the original game.
...
The Dark Lust expansion presents changes to three major components of the main game rules: the foes, the special items, and the optional rules/missions. When playing the game with the expansion, you will use all of the normal rules, charts, etc. of the main game with the exception of the Dark Lust foes and foe chart, the special items and special item chart, and the possible inclusion (if you so choose) of the optional rules/missions.

rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
182854.name: Dungeonbattle Brooklyn (DCC)
182854.description:
From publisher blurb:

Remember the good old days, when orcs were just orcs, dungeons were just dungeons, and bone-sucking pit slime did 1d6 damage, just like everything else in your campaign world? Well those days are good and gone, sucker. Xcrawl is a world of sell-out superstar adventurers, corporate-sponsored action and live-on-pay-per-view mayhem. Enter at your own risk because if you die... YOU DIE!

In Dungeonbattle Brooklyn, the players are young, untested Xcrawl players united by their hopes to go professional. Participating in the first Full Lethal Division IV event, these rank newcomers eager for their first taste at the games might be getting into more than they can handle! The players face orcs, rust monsters, a monstrous scorpion – and Klyriodizka, the geriatric chain-smoking medusa who just needs to pack in one more crawl so she can retire!

182855.name: Beyond The Wicked Maze: Wretched Encounters
182855.description:
From the Introduction:

Beyond The Wicked Maze: Wretched Encounters provides a wealth of goodies for the Exiles Of The Wicked Maze 1 player game. Though the original map and adventure setting may be used, this product provides a wealth of new maze maps and side adventures (provided in the optional rules). The highlight of this product, however, are twenty new foes that may be used alone or alongside of the original foes. Furthermore, these foes can also be used alongside the foes provided in Dark Lust, the first Exiles expansion. Charts are provided for allowing an easy means of combining such foe lists.

In addition to foes, optional adventures, and maps are new special items and a new alchemical substance. These entries are directly connected to the new foes and do not come with an accompanying chart due to their presence in the game being limited to a specific foe encounter.

182856.name: Beyond The Wicked Maze: Hazards & Trickery
182856.description:
From the Introduction:

So you've managed to survive the threats of the mazes below a few times and your exiles no longer fear what might lie within the next corridor beyond... if that's the case then you need some new hazards! This Exiles Of The Wicked Maze expansion pack provides 20 new hazards that you may use alone or in combination with the hazards provided with the main game rules. From forbidden altars to mechanical menaces to the “left behinds” of the deceased, this expansion pack has all sorts of nastiness to mess with your characters!

This expansion for Exiles Of The Wicked Maze includes a new game mechanic called Sacrifice. In this particular product the new rule refers particularly towards dealing with hazards. When a certain hazard has sacrifice as a special disarm/negate option, the character must sacrifice, or rather give up or destroy the item in question in order to bypass trying the beat the hazard.

182857.name: The Hand of Faith (Archetype)
182857.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a new archetype for the cleric that completely customizes the cleric's non spell class abilities through the power of faith. Two new feats relating to this archetype are also presented.

182858.name: Black Heron
182858.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Birdman of Beacon City... Black Heron!

A Power Level 8 Rogue, Black Heron is ready to cause trouble in your next Mutants and Masterminds campaign.

Some heroes just attract the weirdest bad guys... and Black Heron works perfectly as a foil for such heroes! Struggling to earn the respect (or even just the attention) of the world at large, Black Heron will go to any lengths to be seen battling your heroes. His ambitions may frequently outstrip his capabilities, but that doesn't mean he can't make life more complicated for even the most skilled superheroes!

182859.name: Spitting Cobra
182859.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is an early supersonic jet fighter in two variations.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as an illustration.

182860.description:
Temple of the Moon (N)
Use the large tile with the Temple of the Moon on it (N) during setup to replace the large tile that is basically identical to it (E).
The Temple of the Moon space is a construction space equivalent to a Reg.

If you have a building on the Temple of the Moon, then during your Reinforcement phase, you can destroy two discs from your reserve (put them in the box) to place a solitary disc in reinforcement, wherever you like on the board, ignoring the usual reinforcement rules. That is to say that you can place this disc by itself on an empty space and/or on a space adjacent to an enemy building, and/or on a tempest space.

The Emperor cannot be sacrificed to use the Temple of the Moon.

Temple of the Sand (O)

Use the large tile with the Temple of the Sand on it (O) during setup to replace the large tile that is basically identical to it (B).
The Temple of the Sand space is a construction space equivalent to a Reg.

If you have a building on the Temple of the Sand, then one time during your turn, before your Action phase, you can destroy two discs from your reserve (put them in the box) to return an enemy disc (other than an Emperor) from the board to its owner’s reserve.

The Emperor cannot be sacrificed to use the Temple of the Sand.

The Beacon of Eon (U)
The Beacon of Eon tile (U) is intended to be used with the variants that use Tempest tiles. During the setup, add the Beacon of Eon tile wherever you like.

The Beacon of Eon tile is a Tempest tile (see base game rules, page 6).

Whoever occupies the most of the spaces around the Beacon of Eon ignores the rules for Tempest tiles (in the event of a tie, no player benefits from this effect). This player therefore treats Tempest spaces like normal spaces: She does not lose a disc by moving into or through them, and can reinforce her stacks there.
182860.name: Ekö: 3 small expansions

182862.name: Wieża Snów (Issue 10 - Summer 2006)
182862.description:
Wieża Snów
kwartalnik o grach fabularnych
Numer 10 - Lato 2006

182863.name: Skyshine's BEDLAM
182863.description:
BEDLAM™ is a thrilling post-apocalyptic single-player roguelike strategy game, created for the PC utilizing ‘The Banner Saga’ engine.

The player is cast as the mysterious Mechanic, the last known member of a once-thriving guild of intrepid travelers and brilliant inventors. As the Mechanic, you are in charge of commanding your crew in battles, managing your resources, improving your Dozer, interacting with various characters, and protecting your passengers while navigating through the post-apocalyptic land of Bedlam.

Remember – One chance and one crew to make it through!
Think you have what it takes? Then grab the controls, equip your Dozer, load your passengers, assemble your diverse battle-ready crew and prepare for your journey to a new destination on the far edge of Bedlam!

Your goal is to travel from the futuristic metropolis of Bysantine through the chaotic realm of Bedlam to reach the rumored utopia of Aztec City with as many of your passengers and crew intact as possible.

But here is the challenge: with no game saves, you get one chance and one crew to make it! The game is designed for single-session playthroughs, with randomly generated encounters and discoveries to ensure a new experience each time you play!
The path through Bedlam is filled with peril and uncertainty, with numerous obstacles you must prevail to complete the journey. Your reputation and reward depend on the majority of your passengers surviving, so make every action and decision count!

The combat in BEDLAM is turn-based and incorporates our exciting blitz battle system, which has three main features: no turn-order for combatants, powerful Dozer upgrades (various abilities your crew can use on the battlefield), and a primary Dozer weapon that can turn the tide of a battle in an instant!
During battle there is no turn-order among your crew members, allowing you to select anyone on the battle board to move and/or attack each round. Combat plays like carnage-filled chess, with different classes (melee, shotgun, pistol and rifle) that each have a specific movement distance and optimal damage range.

Source: The Game Website.

182864.name: Crazy Cat Lady
182864.description:
In Crazy Cat Lady players must fill the void in their life and cross the threshold into becoming a Crazy Cat Lady! While trying to acquire cats players must balance a job, renovate their home, and deal with general cat maintenance.

The entire game is represented by a deck of 36 cards. Using three smaller decks from these cards, players draw cards using a set amount of points each turn, based on their current job. By acquiring and playing these cards you can advance your career and gain more points per turn, renovate your home to house more cats, and of course acquire more cats as well. The forth deck however causes you to draw an event that adds common cat complications to your life. Plays in 5 minutes (or less).

New Print-And-Play Available Now as of May 7th, 2017 featuring art by Kyle Ferrin!

If you like the game you can purchase a professionally printed copy at the following web address: https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/crazy-cat-lady

182865.description:
Engineering Ants is a cooperative game for 2–4 players. The players take turns rolling a die to move the shared engineering ant token around the board in search of blocked ants. Upon finding a blocked ant, the players work together to build something that will help the blocked ant get around the obstacle. The games includes 12 tubes (4 tall, 8 short), 8 clips, 8 connectors, 8 caps, and an assortments of cardboard pieces giving you wings, propellers, ladders, etc. If the players free all three blocked ants before the anteater token (which moves on certain die rolls and based on the engineering ant landing on certain spots on the board) arrives at the central anthill, then the players win.

From the box:

A creative cooperative building game for 2–4 players, aged 5+.

Beat the Obstacle and Rescue the Ants!

Use your creativity to build solutions to help free the ants.

But watch out! The Anteater is on his way to the anthill! If you can free all of the ants and get them back to the anthill before the Anteater gets there, you all win as a team! Engineering Ants is a game that inspires kids to invent, design and build.
182865.name: Engineering Ants

182866.name: Wieża Snów (Issue 12 - Winter 2005)
182866.description:
Wieża Snów
kwartalnik o grach fabularnych
Numer 12 - Zima/Wiosna 2005/2006

182867.name: Wieża Snów (Issue 13 - Summer 2007)
182867.description:
Wieża Snów
kwartalnik o grach fabularnych
Numer 13 - Lato/Jesień 2007

182868.name: WarStuff
182868.description: WarStuff is a free single-paged ruleset designed to be played with any miniatures or toys you have at hand. The rules are perfect as an introduction to wargaming for kids, and for conventions and pick-up games where players might have models from different lines.

182869.description:
Hong, named after a two-headed dragon in Chinese mythology, is a tile-laying game of asymmetrical goals for two players.

In a mystic land far away an empire is attacked by a fearless dragon master who is trying to conquer the empire by sending two headed dragons (Hongs) to defeat the emperor. As long as the dragons don’t come in big numbers the emperor will be able defend it, but the dragon master knows that a lot of small dragons can be the doom of the empire.
Can the emperor save his land or will the dragon master flood the empire with dragons?

This edition of Hong from White Goblin Games keeps the gameplay of the original design while including a double-sided game board (Castle and Garden), a mini-expansion (Lair of the Seven Great Dragons), and all-new artwork.
182869.name: Hong

182871.name: Earthtongue
182871.description:
A sunless world of fungi and bugs, sustained by a slow rain of nutritious substance, could use your guidance and cataloging.

EarthTongue is a vivarium sim that places in you limited control over a small ecosystem on a fantastical world. You will spend most of your time watching life grow and eat each other to survive. Your subtle nudges will be required to maintain the balance of this world, but it can handle itself much of the time. Player given goals are limited, aside from maximizing the health of your ecosystem. You may choose to try to create a fungal garden to your liking. You may try your best to breed as many beetles as you can. You might use those beetles instead as food stock for the mantises. You might instead just peacefully watch the story of Earthtongue unfold on its own.

Source: The Game Website.

182872.name: Tatou (Issue 8 - Jan 1992)
182872.description:
Tatou
Pour les Aventuriers des Mondes d'Oriflam
N° 8 - Janvier/Fevrier 1992

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Nominee
2015 Jocul Anului în România Advanced Finalist
2016 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Multi-player Nominee
182874.description:
In the thick of the Viennese modern age, exquisite cafés are competing for customers. Inspiring artists, important politicians, and tourists from all over the world are populating Vienna and in need of a hotel room. This is your opportunity to turn your little café into a world famous hotel. Hire staff, fulfill the wishes of your guests, and gain the emperor's favor. Only then will your café become the Grand Austria Hotel.

The start player rolls the dice, sorting them by the rolled number and placing them on the corresponding action spaces. On a turn, a player chooses one of the six actions and carries it out. The number of the available dice in the corresponding action spaces determines how much the player gets from the action. They then remove one of the dice and can carry out additional actions. With the different actions, a player can get the necessary drinks and dishes, prepare the rooms, or hire staff.

But no hotel can grow without guests. To choose wisely which guests to attract and to complete their orders brings some important bonus actions. The staff cards also have different advantages, but the game ends after seven rounds and no player can do everything they want, so whoever makes the right decisions and finds the best way to create bonus actions will win.

With 116 different cards and a new set-up in each game, Grand Austria Hotel provides a huge replay value. Each game stands on its own and demands new tactics and strategies.
182874.name: Grand Austria Hotel
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 24 - Trajan 2-Player Review
Episode 68- Grand Austria Hotel and Gaming Weaknesses
Episode 81 -- Eating Cake in Bellevue (Part B, the Second)
Episode 8: Grand Austria Hotel & Best/Worst Art In Games
Gaming Rules! – Podcast 20
Gaming Rules! – Podcast 21
Gaming Rules! – Podcast 23
Heavy Cardboard Episode 59 – December (2016) Briefing
MOBG 40 7th Scythe 24-10-15
NJAGP Episode 64: Butler in German is German (It's better than diarrhea is painful!)
Podcast 9 [March 2016]
Scythe - Episode 042
The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 62 - LobSterCon XI Roundtable
The Good, The Board and The Milestone Reached: Episode 50!!!!! “Variable Player Powers”
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 44!!! The EPIC Week!!!
WIPNcast 109

182875.description:
Thirty years have passed since the Romans left Britain. The power of the Picts and the Scots is growing, and they are pushing inland. In order to save Britain, the great chieftain Vortigern has asked the Saxon brothers Hengist and Horsa to help defend Britain. You and your brother agree to help, but over the years Vortigern has become greedy and does not pay you enough.

It is time for you to take matters into your own hands and take what is rightfully yours! You have good maps, strong fighters, and stout boats. The coast is littered with villages, towns, monasteries, and estates. All are waiting to be pillaged! Who will win the thrilling hunt for fame and fortune: Hengist or Horsa?

In Hengist, both players compete for the same treasure tiles. The player who reaches a treasure tile with one of his raiding groups first gets the tile — but a part of the road is hidden and must be explored first. Not always is the direct path the most successful way. The player who uses their cards wisely and has a little bit of luck will get the more valuable treasure tiles and win the game.
182875.name: Hengist
boardgamefamily: Lookout Games Fur Zwei Spieler Series
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 64- Tail Feathers & 2016 Predictions/Resolutions
Garrett's Games 497 - Three new 2-player-only releases
Low Player Count - Ep 13 - Luck in Games
Low Player Count - Ep 14 - Free Form
Low Player Count - Ep 16 - It's BGGcon Y'all!
The Game Pit - Episode 56 - The Bumper Review of 2015 (with Top 5s)
The Game Pit: Episode 50 - Treasure Hunt Essen 2015 Part 2
The Game Pit: Episode 54 - Essen 2015 - The Good, The Bad and The Surprising

182877.description:
Legend had it that Ocracoke Island was a haven for pirates and a most mysterious hideout for Blackbeard. To celebrate the harvest of the last plunder, he held a huge party for pirates from across all oceans. Unfortunately, while everyone was present enjoying the party, an explosion interrupted the festivities. The navy had discovered their hideout! Every guest ran for their lives, but biggest treasure was still on Blackbeard's ship, Queen Anne's Revenge. Blackbeard and his men had no choice, but to defend their ship from being captured by the navy!

In Ocracoke: Gold and Glory, if you are the navy, you fight for the glory of the country, trying to collect enough treasure that you can place Blackbeard in jail. Otherwise, you collect as many gold coins as you can, then run away from the turmoil. In game terms, you want to collect five coins before anyone else, and you do this by taking actions:


Use the ability of one of two double-sided action cards, then flip the card to its other side.
Declare the answer with all players.


Players continue for several rounds until one player collects their fifth coin, at which point the game ends immediately.
182877.name: Ocracoke: Gold and Glory

182878.name: Pugmire Gen Con Brochure
182878.description:
From the Back Cover:

Pugmire is one of the first of Onyx Path Publishing's creator-owned games, produced in a partnership with veteran game designer Eddy Webb and his company, Pugsteady. It's also part of the Open Development program featured on the Onyx Path website; you can follow Eddy's posts for updates about this new game.

Some highlights of Pugmire include:

Family-friendly world inspired by comics, novels, films, and games such as Mouse Guard, Redwall, and early Dungeons & Dragons releases like the Expedition to the Barrier Peaks.
Traditional fantasy rules system redesigned for quick creation of heroic characters and streamlined game play, with an emphasis on cooperation and action over competition and violence.
A variety of callings and breeds that give focus to a character's role in society and in the adventuring party.
Rival races, like cats and badgers, along with terrifying and dangerous monsters that roam the landscape.
Iconic characters, like Princess Yosha Pug, and setting hooks to frame the mystery of this world.




Will YOU be a good dog?

182879.name: Who's Boss. Animal Riots: The CARD GAME
182879.description:
From the publisher:

Who's Boss. Animal Riots is a gang battling game for wannabe gang bosses, Rioters and control freaks who love to beat the socks off..midnight roaming shombies, terrifying sheeponators, intimidating bully-builders, a One ton crusher Hippo Butt, lamb chop LORDS who love their steak RAW ants with nanchaku skills gone nuts ,..and many many more wacky characters ready to defend their territory no matter what!!

To win this highly strategic animal powered card game, first you’ll be forced to become a mob boss!!
A number card is placed on the table facing up. Based on the hand of cards, you must play your positively and negatively numbered cards in an increasing or decreasing sequence, kicking your rivals butt through wicked strategies and tactics, leading your blood thirsty crew to victory.

You must try to get rid of your cards by deploying ATTACK cards, COUNTER-ATTACK and REVOKE cards, cards that allow you to predict the next players move, SKIP and FORCE cards and many more!!

To win this highly strategic game, you must decide which cards to play, when to play them and which of your rival Bosses to target.
The game is kids friendly, lots of fun and easy to play.

182880.description:
The game of Catan in a Big Box. Relive Catan in several new ways.

The Catan Big Box combines the base game with several expansions:

Catan: Traders & Barbarians.
Catan geographies: Mallorca and New York.
A tableau with two monuments from Berlin.
Helpers of Catan, a variant with character cards that have special abilities.
A set of pink playing pieces for swapping out another color.
182880.name: Catan: Big Box

182881.name: Stranded No More: The Mutiny
182881.description:
The prequel to Stranded No More, SNM: The Mutiny, is a solitaire game where you lead a crew through a series of missions as Captain Oscar Locke. Years of “poor treatment” has caused the rumblings of a mutiny among the crew aboard The Scream of Atlantis. There is no agreement of who should usurp the Captain but some pirates are angrier than others. As the Captain, you’ll need to balance the anger each of your crew members has while also keeping the mutiny meter below the combustion line. If you can successfully complete all of the missions while keeping your crew happy, will avoid a mutiny and won’t get stranded.

The goal of the game is twofold: get through the chosen missions while avoiding a mutiny and to accumulate the most amount of gold possible. To do the former it’ll likely come at the detriment of the latter. Your ability to manage the levels of anger and mutiny while pressing your luck will determine your success as a Pirate Captain.

182882.name: Red Skies Under Betelgeuse
182882.description:
From publisher blurb:

Just what IS Betelgeuse? Well, it is a sum of its parts. Part sci-fi, part fantasy, part western, part world war, part post apocalypse, part survival horror, part comedy, part vengeance, and part habanero juice rubbed in your eye. There you have it! Hope you enjoy, because there’s plenty of things for everyone.

This 202 page extravaganza is a Campaign Setting made for the Pits & Perils rpg, and even has enough narrative and fluff to make it great for a read or you could just as easily convert it as you see fit.

182883.description:
New Dawn: Exodai is a new alien race for New Dawn.

It includes:
1x Exodai player board
8x Exodai Technology cards
182883.name: New Dawn: Exodai

182884.name: The Aeromancer Playbook
182884.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Playbook and Character sheet for the Aeromancer class in Dungeonworld. Select you own preferred playstyle as you utilise this offensive support class to rain havoc upon your enemies while postering the oppertunities of you allies by invoking elemental air magics.

182885.name: Scraps of the Rust Empire
182885.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Empire of Rust.
A land that spans from the undead controlled oil fields in the far north through the remains of some of the greatest pre-fall cultural centers humanity ever lost. Focusing on details of Oilberta, the Pacific Providence, the Under-Sea, Bridge City, and the Lilac City. There is a vast volume of information from large scale culture to more localized businesses.

Inside you will find details about the last humans to fall, the Genjian, as well as the faith driven Nation of Accensor and the faithless Red Star.
Here you will find details about the Cult of Fallow Hopes along with a section that outlines many scientific ‘discoveries’ about the nature of the plague that ended humanity.

182886.name: Valentin Krupova
182886.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oops! That six-hour marathon game session started 15 minutes ago, and you have already killed a player character (PC)! He was decapitated while being consumed in dragon fire, and his corpse fell into a sphere of annihilation. Your prediction for recovery is “not likely.” You built pre-generated characters for this campaign six months and four character levels ago! You don’t want your player to sit and read the newspaper for the next 5.75 hours. You need a comparable-level character sheet quickly.

OR… A new player has just shown up to your table willing to learn to sling dice. You found out he or she was coming thirty minutes before game time. Your regular crew of miscreants has already killed off all the spare pre-generated characters you rolled up with gleeful abandon, while cackling wildly and uttering something about “drive ‘em like you stole ‘em.” You want this first gaming experience to be fun and memorable, so you don’t want to completely wing it. You need a character sheet, right now.

Welcome to Instant Character! Just add a player, and go! In this product, you will discover twenty complete stat blocks for a single PC, level 1 through 20, adhering to the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game rules. The core format adheres to the standard non-player character (NPC) stat block most GMs are already familiar with minus the Tactics section. This makes it easier for the GM to assist with finding information and also prepares the player for the day he or she is running games! The Special Abilities section includes more detailed write-ups of feats and character abilities than a standard NPC stat block to facilitate faster play. Sources for spells, races, classes, archetypes, and prestige classes from sources other than the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook™ (PZO1110) are listed in the Sources section and can be referenced in the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Reference Document.

At the end of this document is a sheet of character and spell tokens including a token for this character and assorted Non-Player Characters (NPCs) and spell effects. For best results, print the token page and laminate the entire sheet. Initially cut out into squares. To improve ability to move and pick up the laminated tokens, trim off the gray corners to make an octagonal shape.

Snapshot Statement

Valentin is a lawful good male halfling with paladin levels using the empyreal knight archetype who specializes in ranged combat and making use of his canine mount in small spaces.

182887.name: Red Cap
182887.description:
From publisher blurb:

Having trouble squashing that pesky spider? Heheheh ... I'm sure you and I can have a BLAST tracking him down and dowsing him in flaming oil!!! AAAHAAAAHAHAHAHAhahaha ...

Red Cap is a bitter, yet brilliant, scientist who injected himself with experimental enhancements. His goal in life is to put an end to that do-gooding "people's hero" Recluse, and he will stop at nothing to put the young man down. Iconic Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

182888.name: Lord d'Arc
182888.description:
From publisher blurb:

"All shall be safe, and all shall OBEY, under the rule of d'Arc!"

Lord d'Arc (PL 12) is a genius tyrant who believes only under his iron rule can the world survive. A master of science and sorcery, a renowned vampire hunter, and a dedicated ruler of his people, Lord d'Arc is also driven by his need to prove himself superior to Richard Hughes of the Challenger Foundation.

182889.name: Fungi Mine: Adventure and Sourcebook
182889.description:
From publisher blurb:

When aliens are suddenly being seen around Mount Carmel near Rutland, Vermont many enthusiats seek to see the aliens for themselves.

As these UFO enthusiasts come to Mount Carmel, two young people go missing. With the search coming up empty and UFO groups in the area pushing their weak evidence, can the investigators find out what is going on before more people go missing? Can they stop the strange men, espcially one wearing a mask, that the enthusiasts see as some kind of saviour?

Discover the evil that lurks around Mount Carmel and overcome the dangers of the Mi-go and their cultist pawns.

Also inside over 10 pages of new psychic skills that can be usable in any d6 game!

182890.name: Caveat Emptor
182890.description:
From publisher blurb:

So your PCs have gone to the market to pick up some last minute things for their next adventure... Rope, a few extra arrows, some trail rations, and an 11-foot pole when a 10-foot one simply won't do. You could simply say "Ok, that'll be 4 gold, 2 silver, and 3 copper, don't forget to mark them off your character sheet." Or you could offer a richer environment for roleplaying with a marketplace to explore. Imagine haggling with the store clerk over that 11-foot pole's price. "Why's it cost more than a 10-foot pole?" And then the real fun begins...

But without NPCs in the marketplace to interact with, that can get a little dull. That's where Insta-NPCs #10: Caveat Emptor comes in.

Caveat Emptor features include:

8 tables offering thousands of unique combinations of buyers and sellers in a marketplace setting
15 examples of NPCs created for fantasy, science fiction, and horror genres
2 revamped tables showing how to use the product as-is for science fiction as well as fantasy
1 worksheet for printing the whole process on a single page to use later
Nearly 6,000 words of material across 13 pages (10 pages of content)
All in a system-neutral, rules-neutral format for use with all your favorite games!




Caveat can be used for any setting or system. Need a market for a science fiction, fantasy, horror, or western adventure? I bet this will help!

182891.name: To Claw the Surface
182891.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scratch For Sunlight. Gasp For Air.

The brave and the foolhardy flock to the dwarven village of Granitetop Mountain to make their fortunes escorting caravans and clearing mineshafts of monsters. When a cave-in pulls your adventurers into a massive fissure and strands them deep beneath the mountain’s surface with no obvious egress, they must use all of their wits and cunning to make it out alive. But survival is the only law in this deep and untamed wilderness, and adventurers are just as good as the next meal to the creatures that dwell in the darkness. Will the adventurers ever breathe the fresh air of the surface again—or will their lives be forfeit in these dangerous, maddening depths?

To Claw the Surface is an exciting adventure module in Jon Brazer Enterprises’ Deadly Delves series, and is compatible with the best-selling Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. This adventure is designed to challenge four to five 1st-level PCs like no other content has to date. Inside this 57-page volume, you’ll find:

11 new and modified monsters, 6 fully-statted NPCs, 11 new traps, and 2 new haunts for your Pathfinder campaign
11 full-color maps of the various passageways and forgotten structures buried deep under the mountain
20 new alchemical items, 3 new materials from which to make weapons and armor, 2 new pieces of equipment, a new intelligent item, and a new cursed item
Innovative encounters with the denizens of the deeps, including crazed derro, cruel duergar, hungry vermin, malformed giants, primeval dwarves, and vengeful haunts
Enough content to take your group of 1st-level PCs all the way to 4th level




Dangers Unknown. Treasures Untold. Adventure Awaits.

182892.name: Trick or Treat
182892.description:
Trick or Treat takes every kid's favorite part of Halloween and packs it into a fun filled, adventurous candy gathering card game. Which is perfect for those occasional rainy Halloweens, Halloween parties or those days when your family just wants to wear costumes.

Each player takes turns rolling dice to flip cards on the corresponding houses. Their goal is to become the big winner on the block who has collected the most candy, while trying to avoid a number of obstacles that make trick or treating an adventure.

182893.name: Blackbone
182893.description:
From publisher blurb:

Things that go bump in the night have their own bogeyman. Blackbone is a relentless hunter of all things supernatural, an implacable fanatic that will never stop its savage crusade to destroy users of magic and their ilk wherever they may hide. Do you have what it takes to stand against this murderous marauder and bane of the supernatural community?

Blackbone is a PL 11 threat to add to your Mutants & Masterminds campaign.

182894.name: Skateboard Champion
182894.description:
From publisher blurb:

You and your family have moved to a new town, just in time for the first day of school. You notice a number of kids are members of a skateboarding clique, and you would like to join. The requirements are tough, but you are too.

182895.name: Partying Puppies
boardgameversion: Partying Puppies: Classic or Crack Edition
182895.description:
Partying Puppies is a lighthearted walk through a land of Puppyliciousness, with a dark zombie undercurrent that you are always trying to avoid. The object of the game is simple, be the last puppy standing as the other players fall to the zombie apocalypse; the last player not to be bitten by a zombie and get infected by the virus wins! It's that easy.

The twist of Partying Puppies is not only do you get to avoid getting bit by presenting an antidote card, or skip a turn, or the usual expected game mechanics but there are physical tasks to accomplish along the way. As a result, it's a combination card game, truth or dare, and charade mix. To progress a card may call on you to bark like a pup,fetch something, or force another player to do your ridiculous task.

182896.name: John Carter: Warlord of Mars – The Board Game
182896.description:
Description from the publisher:

In John Carter: Warlord of Mars – The Board Game, you'll enact the greatest adventures across the ancient world of Barsoom as you lead your heroes through crumbling ruins and take to the skies in the beautiful ships of the Helium Navy. Can you save Barsoom from ruin at the hands of dastardly scientists or ancient forces?

182898.name: Kampen om Strängnäs
182898.description: This belongs to a series of promotional Monopoly clones featuring local businesses and trivia, published around 1988-1992. As in Monopoly you move around a board collecting "shares" and hope for others to land on your properties, although the specifics are slightly different. Obviously the trivia elements vary from game to game within the series, and there are also some small mechanical variations, e.g. in the composition of event cards and how rent is calculated.

182899.name: Kampen om Eskilstuna
182899.description: This belongs to a series of promotional Monopoly clones featuring local businesses and trivia, published around 1988-1992. As in Monopoly you move around a board collecting "shares" and hope for others to land on your properties, although the specifics are slightly different. Obviously the trivia elements vary from game to game within the series, and there are also some small mechanical variations, e.g. in the composition of event cards and how rent is calculated.

182900.name: The Lost Ninja
182900.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can You Rescue A Fellow Ninja From The Hands Of Japanese Gangsters?

You are a skilled fighter, well versed in the martial arts and the art of ninjutsu. One day you are talking with Saito, a strange boy from your class, when a car suddenly pulls up. You watch as two men jump out, shove Saito into their car, and drive off. Everything happens so fast. You're not certain, but you think the men are yakuza, a ruthless band of Japanese gangsters. You want to do something to help Saito, but what?

182901.description:
This promo card is part of a special Battle of Durak promotion.

Skill Card Action:
Polymorph - Once all players have chosen their character classes, shuffle all left over skill cards and choose 3 at random. Exchange this card for those skills.
182901.name: Battle of Durak: Shapeshifter Promo Card

182902.name: Daredevil Park
182902.description:
From publisher blurb:

You've seen the scary TV commercials; you've heard the advertisements. Now you've been chosen as one of the four lucky young daredevils who will test the rides before the park opens. You're supposed to wait until the following day for your escorted tour through Daredevil Park, but one of the other contest winners, Tom Harber, wants to sneak inside and explore the park right now. Will you join him, or can you wait until the morning to experience the amazing wonders of the Black Hole and Transylvania Island?

182903.name: Kampen om Örebro
182903.description: This belongs to a series of promotional Monopoly clones featuring local businesses and trivia, published around 1988-1992. As in Monopoly you move around a board collecting "shares" and hope for others to land on your properties, although the specifics are slightly different. Obviously the trivia elements vary from game to game within the series, and there are also some small mechanical variations, e.g. in the composition of event cards and how rent is calculated.

182904.name: Kidnapped!
182904.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can You Outwit The Kidnappers And Make Your Way To Freedom ?

You have been invited to visit your friend Jason after school. When you arrive, you are surprised to find that he is extremely wealthy and that he lives in a mansion. While you are racing Jason down his driveway, a stranger suddenly approaches and gestures for you and Jason to get in his car. A security guard lies wounded on the ground, and you realize that you're about to be kidnapped. What will you do?

182905.name: The Search for Aladdin's Lamp
182905.description:
From publisher blurb:

Will You Find The Fabled Lamp Of Aladdin--And Live To Tell The Story?"

You and your aunt are in Istanbul, Turkey, searching for the legendary lamp of Aladdin. While looking for clues, you stumble upon a secret stairwell that leads to a small passageway. There you notice a lamp on a hook, high above you on the wall. It might be Aladdin's lamp, but something tells you it might not be, and perhaps you should leave it alone. What will you do?

182906.name: Kampen om Södertälje
182906.description: This belongs to a series of promotional Monopoly clones featuring local businesses and trivia, published around 1988-1992. As in Monopoly you move around a board collecting "shares" and hope for others to land on your properties, although the specifics are slightly different. Obviously the trivia elements vary from game to game within the series, and there are also some small mechanical variations, e.g. in the composition of event cards and how rent is calculated.

182907.name: Vampire Invaders
182907.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are one of the world's leading experts on vampires. You've been invited to attend an emergency conference at the National Space Institute, where you and the top officials from the FBI, the air force, and NASA are examining evidence that vampires from outer space have invaded the Earth. Your expertise is needed to track down the vampires. Where should your mission begin -- in Oklahoma, where a suspicious UFO was recently sighted? Or in New Orleans, where a gruesome vampire murder has just taken place?

182908.name: The Terrorist Trap
182908.description:
From publisher blurb:

A note from Kyle, an older brother who's a reporter for the city newspaper, says that he's out investigating a hot lead on a story, and if he's not back by six o'clock, then the police must be called. It's just past six, and readers have to decide what to do next, and when.

182909.name: Ghost Train
182909.description:
From publisher blurb:

While you are visiting the farm of your friend Harry, you discover that someone has been sabotaging their land. Late one night, you see a mysterious Indian woman goes to the orchards and decide to follow her. Suddenly, you hear the sound of a train coming from the road there abandoned nearby. You know that no train passed through this place in over fifty years. You want to investigate, but do not want the Indian woman to get away. What will you do?

182910.description:
Pathfinder Battles: Iconic Heroes Set 6 includes seven all-new miniatures featuring legendary characters from the Pathfinder role-playing universe: Seltyiel, Feiya, Quinn, Reiko, Lem, Daji and Hayato! Characters featured in this set are:


Seltyiel, half-elf magus
Feiya, human witch
Quinn, human investigator
Reiko, human ninja
Lem, halfling bard
Daji, animal companion
Hayato, human samurai


Each Iconic Heroes set also includes exclusive Cards (one for each miniature) for use in the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game, with Iconic Heroes Set 6 including Boon cards.
182910.name: Pathfinder Battles: Iconic Heroes Set 6

182911.name: Masters of Umdaar
rpgseries: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System
182911.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rise up against the Masters of Umdaar!

Behold the fallen world of Umdaar, home to savage warriors, cyborg insects, and merciless warlords. Oh, and lasers — lots and lots of lasers. The Masters rule with an iron fist, and the people’s only hope are the archaeonauts and their quest for long-lost artifacts of power. But will the Masters get there first? Masters of Umdaar, our latest Fate World of Adventure by Dave Joria, is a retro tribute to such shiny serials as John Carter of Mars, Flash Gordon, He-Man, and Thundercats.

Masters of Umdaar requires Fate Accelerated Edition to play. This 51-page supplement includes:

A randomized Fate dice system to create a wide variety of sci-fi/fantasy characters like robots, mutants, talking animals, and more
Character class breakdowns based on Fate Accelerated approaches, with a wide variety of options
New rules for cliffhangers—a new form of obstacle to overcome—with rules that encourage the use of different approaches
A variety of tools to easily populate your adventures, including a beast generator, trap guidelines, and sample artifacts
A sample adventure—The Starblades of Su’ul—as well as seeds for further adventures

182912.name: Tome of Tomes Volume One
182912.description:
From publisher blurb:

Books in fantasy games have always been sources of mystery. We're all familiar with the sight of the magic user's eyes lighting up like a 5-year-old at Christmas when one is found. This work provides 100 tomes for your gaming pleasure, ranging from the magical to the mundane, from the common to the unique. Never again will you be at a loss to describe that recently found libram.

Tome of Tomes is a compilation of books that could be found on a sage's shelf or on the shelves of a city library. Each tome is described and classified according to field of study and special knowledge category (if applicable).

182913.name: Tome of Tomes Volume Two
182913.description:
From publisher blurb:

Books in fantasy games have always been sources of mystery. We're all familiar with the sight of the magic user's eyes lighting up like a 5-year-old at Christmas when one is found. This work provides 100 more tomes for your gaming pleasure, ranging from the magical to the mundane, from the common to the unique. Never again will you be at a loss to describe that recently found libram.

Tome of Tomes Volume Two is a compilation of books that could be found on a sage's shelf or on the shelves of a city library. Each tome is described and classified according to field of study and special knowledge category (if applicable).

182914.name: Jake and the Never Land Pirates: Shipwreck Beach Treasure Hunt Game
182914.description:
From the publisher:
Yo ho, let’s go! Captain Hook has buried pirate booty all over Shipwreck Beach. Flip over the gold doubloons and use Jake’s spyglass to decode the secret clues. When you get a match, get up and go! Snag the correct treasure with the foam sword and hurry back to score!

Promotes:
Matching
Memory
Physical Dexterity

182915.description:
ATTACK RAID SURROUND

Troy circa 1200 BCE

Your destiny lies in your hands, as you stand before the ancient city of Troy, known to the ancient Greeks as Ilios. Attack, raid, surround and defend in campaigns between the Greeks and the Trojans found in Homer’s epic tale “The Iliad.”

In ILIOS: Battle for Troy, 2 to 4 players take turns deploying warrior tiles with white rays representing spears and swords and their directions of attack. When a player raids a warrior tile, they place a disk of their color to occupy it. Warrior tiles are occupied by different players throughout the game until a tile is completely surrounded. It is then removed from the board, and added to the plunder of the player occupying it. Multiple tiles may be surrounded on one play, and surrounded tiles may be occupied by other players. This means your opponents can plunder on your turn!

Troy Expansion

The climax of the battles of Troy was the capture of the fortified city of Troy, which was only taken with the Trojan horse. Capture Troy yourself with the aid of the horses and oracles.

This Social Abstract Game SAG calls for a blend of offensive and defensive strategies, with suspense introduced by the random draw of tiles.

The deluxe version using beautiful wooden tiles is available now as part of the Ancient World Treasure Chest Collection.

ILIOS was designed to be a Social Abstract Game SAG for 2 to 4 players.
182915.name: ILIOS

182916.name: Tatou (Issue 9 - Jul 1992)
182916.description:
Tatou
Pour les Aventuriers des Mondes d'Oriflam
N° 9 - Juillet/Aout 1992

182917.description: Walrus is a mutant hero that can gain the vigilante special action Press. The promo comes in every Kickstarter copy of Ninja Camp, also by Action Phase Games.
182917.name: Heroes Wanted: Walrus Promo Card

182918.name: Tatou (Issue 10 - Nov 1992)
182918.description:
Tatou
Pour les Aventuriers des Mondes d'Oriflam
N° 10 - Novembre/Decembre 1992

182920.name: Tatou (Issue 11 - Jan 1993)
182920.description:
Tatou
Pour les Aventuriers des Mondes d'Oriflam
N° 11 - Janvier/Fevrier 1993

182921.name: Tatou (Issue 12 - Mar 1993)
182921.description:
Tatou
Pour les Aventuriers des Mondes d'Oriflam
N° 12 - Mars/Avril 1993

182922.name: Tatou (Issue 13 - May 1993)
182922.description:
Tatou
Pour les Aventuriers des Mondes d'Oriflam
N° 13 - Mai/Juin 1993

182924.name: Treeker: The Lost Glasses
182924.description:
Treeker: The Lost Glasses is a first-person adventure game, with puzzle and platform elements. In the game, the player needs to use a pair of glasses in order to see mysterious objects left behind by some sort of ancient civilization.

Across the centuries, pirates and treasure hunters mysteriously appear with a pair of uncanny glasses. But suddenly as they are revealed, they disappear from sight leaving no hint of what that object truly is. They must be the same glasses, in different times, but you are the only one to realize that, and travel in search for this treasure, to unfold its secrets.

Use the lens to advance in the game, and discover the secrets of these forgotten islands.

Source: The Game Website.

182925.name: Halo: Fleet Battles – UNSC Core Battle Group Upgrade
182925.description: The contents of this boxed set can be used by UNSC players to either upgrade their Halo: Fleet Battles force with additional medium and small firepower or act as the foundation for a new force. At the heart of the upgrade box are four Marathon-class Heavy Cruisers and 24 Paris-class Frigates, a fantastic core addition to any UNSC fleet. Marathon Heavy Cruisers are the bulk heavy hitters for the UNSC, able to be deployed in either a standalone or supported role, and are commonly fielded in Battle Groups consisting of Paris-class Frigates in either Arrowhead or Trident Formation. Also in the box are Formation Bases and Ship Overlay Sheets for all models included.

182926.name: Halo: Fleet Battles – Covenant Core Battle Group Upgrade
182926.description: The contents of this boxed set can be used by Covenant players to either upgrade their Halo: Fleet Battles force with additional medium and small firepower or act as the foundation for a new force. At the heart of the upgrade box are two powerful CCS-class Battlecruisers and they are joined by 12 SDV Heavy Corvettes, acting as a fantastic core addition to any Covenant fleet. CCS-class Battlecruisers are a key part of any Covenant fleet, able to lay down devastating weapons fire when needed and capable of delivering bombers or interceptors directly into the heart of a battle. Also in the box are Formation Bases and Ship Overlay Sheets for all models included.

182929.name: Why So Evil 2: Dystopia
182929.description:
This is a sequel of an indie game Why So Evil. You have to change the color of your cube to match the color of platforms or walls featured in the game. Fast thinking and reflexes are required in order for you to survive all the traps and the attacks of your enemies. It will try to surprise you on your every move, and most probably succeed. And when you think you have finally won and you are safe, something will go wrong and make your little world a living hell. This game is specially made for people who want some real challenge, so don't get disappointed if you die, even on the first few levels. Be quick and resourceful and enjoy yourself.

Source: The Publisher Website.

182930.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Grey Havens and its 165 new cards allow you to adventure along the westernmost edges of Middle-earth, and then travel even further west...across the uncharted waters where the proud hosts of Númenor met their doom many long generations back. Three new scenarios feature mechanics for ships and sailing, as well as a heavy emphasis on exploration. Then, even as the troubled dreams of one Gondorian nobleman spur you to undertake an epic journey to the ruins of Númenor, The Grey Havens casts you deep into turbulent waters where Corsairs, Raiders, Undead, and the seas themselves pose constant threats.

The Grey Havens, a deluxe expansion for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game, contains 165 new cards including: 3 new quests, 12 new encounter sets, 2 new heroes, as well as new allies, events, and attachments for each sphere of influence.
182930.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Grey Havens
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

182931.name: Tatou (Issue 14 - Jul 1993)
182931.description:
Tatou
Pour les Aventuriers des Mondes d'Oriflam
N° 13 - Juillet/Aout 1993

182932.name: Tatou (Issue 15 - Sep 1993)
182932.description:

Pour les Aventuriers des Mondes d'Oriflam
