182939.description:
Tatou
Pour les Aventuriers des Mondes d'Oriflam
N° 25 - Aout/Septembre 1995

182940.name: Underdark Racial Feats
182940.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Underdark Racial Feats is our latest Mythic Mini devoted to an assortment of playable PC races from the deep places below the earth, including drow, duergar, and svirfneblin! This product contains 13 marvelous mythic feats for deep-dwelling subterranean adventurers to strike out into the lighted lands above or to delve the dungeons below, from Drow Nobility and Spider Summoner to Giant Steps, Stoic Pose, and Umbral Scion!

Mythic Minis are short, inexpensive products designed to take one rules concept or set of Pathfinder RPG rules and bring them to you in a new way for the mythic rules, including converting existing rules as well as introducing entirely new rule options. Created by the same designers that helped bring you the official mythic rules, Mythic Minis skip the fluff and give you all crunch, all the time.

Nobody knows mythic like Legendary Games, and whether it's new mythic feats, class abilities, path abilities, magic items, or anything else, every Mythic Mini delivers a delicious dollop of dazzling design that will fill out your mythic experience one slice at a time. Check for a new Mythic Mini every Monday to make your game just a little more Legendary!

182941.name: Tatou (Issue 26 - Dec 1996)
182941.description:
Tatou
Pour les Aventuriers des Mondes d'Oriflam
N° 26 - Decembre/Janvier 1996

182942.name: Mystara Player's Handbook
182942.description:
User Description:

This document is a conversion of general Mystara information from the Basic/Expert/Companion/Master/Immortal sequence of Basic D&D boxed sets into a format suitable for use with 5th edition D&D. The author asked questions of the Mystara community on facebook and directly contacted Bruce Heard (The original line developer for Mystara). The author refers to this document as a fan created work.

182943.name: Stellaris
videogamehonor: 2016 Global Game Awards Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Best PC Game Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
182943.description:
Dynamic Worlds with a vast number of Unique Random Species

Design and name a custom species with the government and attributes you desire. Encounter countless different alien species, each with unique appearances, traits, and ethics.

Research and Reverse-engineer rare technologies

The skills and personalities of your scientists will affect which technologies you can develop. Many technologies are unique and must be found or reverse-engineered from debris, wrecks or alien ruins...

Be wary of the Cost of Progress

The expanses of the galaxy hold many dangers, as do your own advances at home... Can you really trust your robot workers?

Source: The Game Website.

182947.name: 7 Summits:  A Mountaineering Challenge
182947.description:
7 Summits: A Mountaineering Challenge is a game for one to four players in which players test their mountaineering skills against the highest mountain on each continent. First player to climb the seven mountains wins the game!

Choose which mountains you want to climb at your own pace and in any order that you want. There are ten different mountains from which to choose, each with unique statistics and rewards for successfully climbing them.

Use up to four gear pieces to prevent deadly accidents represented with a roll of the dice. Upgrade your acclimatization to prevent altitude sickness. Choose which climber cards you want to upgrade as you draw them to increase your movement speed on a mountain.

There are many risks for which you must prepare in this difficult challenge of climbing the highest mountain on each of the seven continents, and there are many people who want to climb them before you do. How will you attempt this deadly challenge?

182948.description:
Orphanage of Fear is a social deduction game for six to seventeen players in the vein of Werewolf or Mafia. Players are either orphan children or sinister boogeymen. Hiding in plain sight the boogeymen wake each night to drag a child into their realm under the bed to fears upon their fear. During the day they hide themselves behind the masks of their previous victims.

The children have to find out who these monsters are, but they are not entirely alone. In desperation the children can take comfort with what toys the orphanage has, and may draw abilities from the toys themselves. They can shine the light of the magic projector to discover the true identity of the target, shield themselves during the night with their teddy bear, save themselves from the monster in the closet by feeding it their limberjack or hide under the blanket to shield them from all danger, but beware not all toys were placed there for the benefit of the children. The boogeymen can bring their own sackcloth doll to throw off the magic projector and make others perceive an innocent child as a boogeyman.

Unfortunately, the children can’t always rely on toys being there. The orphanage is short, even with many children now missing, and so every round the kindly, but out of his depth, caretaker sees to it that what toys are available are taken back and then given out at random.

Orphanage of Fear uses the traditional day night cycle of Werewolf. During the night the Boogeymen choose a child to drag into their realm of existence, along with the toy they are holding, to feed, and during the day the entire group debates and argues about who the impostors are before nominating a child or children. If only one child is nominated they can drag another child with them to the closet door. The player with the most votes is sent into the closet and gets eaten, along with their toy, by the monster inside. The game continues until either all the boogeymen are eaten by the closet monster at which point the children win or there are an equal amount of children and boogeymen at which point the boogeymen win.
182948.name: Orphanage of Fear
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 70: Thursday, September 29th

182949.name: 1999: Hore, Mita koto ka! Seikimatsu
182949.description:
1999: Hore, Mita koto ka! Seikimatsu or "1999: Look, Do you see that?! It's the End of the Century" is a turn based strategy board game for the Famicom.

Aliens invade earth just in time for the new millennium in this crossover between Monopoly and the Game of life.

Source: Wikipedia, "1999: Hore, Mita koto ka! Seikimatsu", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

182950.name: ERA: Caliphport Setting Pack
182950.description:
Publisher Blurb:

"CALIPHPORT is the first setting pack for ERA: Epic Storytelling Game. Caliphport is a golden city surrounded by mysterious desert and home to kings, pirates, brigands, slaves, sorcerors and djinn. Add some 'Arabian Nights' to your ERA games and challenge your Legends to a new experience."

182951.name: Der Vampir von Havena
rpgitemversion: The Vampire of Havena Solo Adventure English Softcover
The Vampire of Havena Solo Adventure PDF
182951.description:
"Der Vampir von Havena" ("The Vampire of Havena") is a solitaire adventure set in the dockland area of the city of Havena.

Type: detective story, mystery

182952.name: Rory's Story Cubes: Animalia
182952.description:
An expansion to the creativity game Rory's Story Cubes. This set includes 3 new dice with 18 thematic actions.

This expansion can be played on its own or in combination with the original game.

The game is useful as an aid to creative problem solving, language learning and story telling. Players roll the dice and then tell a story using the actions. "Once upon a time..."

182953.name: Rory's Story Cubes: Fright
182953.description:
An expansion to the creativity game Rory's Story Cubes. This set includes 3 new dice with 18 thematic actions.

This expansion can be played on its own or in combination with the original game.

The game is useful as an aid to creative problem solving, language learning and story telling. Players roll the dice and then tell a story using the actions. "Once upon a time..."

182954.description:
An expansion to the creativity game Rory's Story Cubes. This set includes 3 new dice with 18 thematic actions.

This expansion can be played on its own or in combination with the original game.

The game is useful as an aid to creative problem solving, language learning and story telling. Players roll the dice and then tell a story using the actions. "Once upon a time..."
182954.name: Rory's Story Cubes: Mythic

182955.description:
An expansion to the creativity game Rory's Story Cubes. This set includes 9 new dice with 54 action images or "picto-verbs."

This expansion can be played on its own or in combination with the original game. The newest version is printed in dark blue ink to help distinguish the dice from other Story Cube dice.

The game is useful as an aid to creative problem solving, language learning and story telling. Players roll the dice and then tell a story using the actions. "Once upon a time..."
182955.name: Rory's Story Cubes: Moomin

182956.name: Hacker Dice
182956.description:
In Hacker Dice players are hackers trying to gain control of a network of servers for their own nefarious (or virtuous!) purposes.

The game combines a Yahtzee-style mechanism of rolling dice with a memory element of remembering the defenses of the servers. Players gain control of servers by breaking through their defenses. They can increase their chances by creating malware.

182957.name: Tsunami Quarterly Review (Issue 11 - Summer 2015)
rpgissuearticle: RPG Crucible: Talk Like a Pirate
182957.description:
From publisher blurb:

In our eleventh issue of Tsunami Quarterly Review, you will find the following great features:

RPG Crucible: Talk Like a Pirate: Bring characters to life with a variety of vocal expressions.
Skill Challenges Go To Sea: Our series on skill challenges sets sail for a completely new perspective on adventuring on the high seas.
GMing Tips & Tricks: JiB explores giving your game a sense of character and a voice in the narrative.
Cultures of the Realm: Explore three new races for your Tsunami Living Campaign. Continue your quest for the Shards of Malvoc with exciting new PC and NPC cultures at your disposal!
Shadows of Esteren: George Sedgwick takes a detailed look at a newer fun and exciting fantasy game.

182958.name: Fall of the Tower
182958.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fall of the Tower is a momentous adventure for the Accursed game line. It represents a turning point in the struggle for the future of Morden, a savage blow struck against either the Witches who have conquered the land or the Order of the Penitent that seeks to save it.

The Order has tracked down a woman whom they believe to be the last surviving Seelie Fey. With her help, it may be possible to strike and destroy Turris Atra, the Chimera's base of power. However, doing so risks the Order's own base of operations. Dare the heroes attempt such a crippling strike?

This adventure was originally run exclusively at Gen Con 2014 for a group of Kickstarter Backers. It includes six pregenerated Witchmarked player characters. Those characters are also available as alternative face cards, compatible with our existing Accursed decks. These replace the Jacks of the appropriate suits.

The PDF version includes print & play versions of the cards, designed to be used with letter sized pre-perforated business card sheets, such as Avery 5870. Page 1 shows the card backs. page 2 shows the card faces. The PDF uses a monotone card background and back, to avoid alignment issues when printing on prepunched sheets. Both of these are markedly different from the Print on Demand version.

182959.name: Stranded: A Quick Card Game
182959.description:
Stranded is quick easy card game. It is about a group of people who crash land in a forest somewhere and need to survive until help arrives. Unfortunately everyone is out to save their own skin. Can you survive long enough to be rescued?

Game play is for 2-5 players and lasts anywhere from 10-20 minutes. Stranded is played in rounds with the simple mechanics of draw a card them play a card if able. The first player to receive 5 points or hold the highest number at the end of the deck is the winner.

182960.description:
Termity is a strategy game about the grappling of indefatigable insects for 2 to 4 players.

At first glance, life goes slowly on the African plains scorched by the sun. Or so it seems. In the thicket of grass, termite swarms fight relentless battles. It is the territorial instinct that makes them contend perpetually. There is a tangible evidence for their fierceness - huge mounds which contain millions of insect warriors always ready to defend their fortress.

Prove your artifice and strategic thinking ability by fighting for survival with your opponents, conquering mounds and expanding into new territories.

The aim of the game is to take control over enemy and neutral mounds and defend your own nests. The player who has power over mounds with the biggest amount of points at the end of the game becomes the winner.
182960.name: Termity

182961.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Shadowrun: Crossfire - Demo Box is a trial version of the game that's perfect for learning the rules. We carefully picked out a subset of the full game that shows off Crossfire's feel and mechanisms in a small, elegant package. The demo box takes you through a shorter, tighter version of the "Caught in the Crossfire" mission included in the full game — it's the quickest way for new players to learn how to play.

Catalyst Game Labs is giving the Shadowrun: Crossfire - Demo Box to select gamers at Gen Con 2013 in mid-August.


The shadows of the Sixth World have every kind of danger you can imagine: ultra-violent gangers, flesh-eating ghouls, mages that summon spirits from toxic waste, backstabbing corporate raiders, hard-nosed police officers, and even dragons. You don't have much — mainly your guts, your wits, and your friends — but maybe that's enough. Between you and your teammates, you can sling spells, hack the Matrix, talk a tiger out of his stripes, and bring down a charging ork from a hundred yards away. Will that be enough to face down the worst the mean streets can throw at you? You're about to find out.

Shadowrun: Crossfire is a cooperative deck-building card game for two to four players set in the gritty, cyberpunk fantasy world of Shadowrun. Play a shadowrunner team and take on tough jobs such as protecting a client who's marked for death, shooting your way out of downtown when a run goes sour, or facing down a dragon. In each game you'll improve your deck with a mix of strategies, while earning Karma to give your character cyber upgrades, physical augmentations, magical initiations, weapons training and Edge.

Shadowrun: Crossfire - Demo Box includes two obstacle decks, a black market deck, a crossfire event deck, a mission sheet, 4 role cards, and 2 product information cards.

Differences from Shadowrun: Crossfire

- The crossfire card deck & obstacle decks are smaller than the full game

- The Demo box contains only 1 scenario (so the only way to play this version) and it is not included in the main Shadowrun: Crossfire game

- There are only four character cards (1 of which is the troll mage card which is not found in the base set, but was reprinted in Character Expansion Pack 1)

- The Demo box does not contain any tokens, and requires the players to use something of their own (coins etc.)

- The rulebook is shorter and does not contain all the rules listed in the base game, but contains information specific to the Demo box
182961.name: Shadowrun: Crossfire – Demo Box
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games

182962.name: Méli Mélo Circus
182962.description:
From the publisher:

Play with family and friends and recompose Jef, Walter, George, Colette and Nicolas. When it's your go, throw the dice and step by step put the body parts back together. Head, chest, legs, arms - the first one completing a whole body is the winner!

182964.name: Skraag: La Fortezza degli Orchi
182964.description:
From the back of the book:
Skraag descrive accuratamente la storia, la religione ed il potere della più imponente cittadella di orchi, e le caratteristiche, le motivazioni, e gli scopi dei suoi abitanti. Barbari assassini, sanguinari sacerdoti e orde devastanti di soldati orchi costituiscono la principale forza offensiva della fortezza.

English translation:
Skraag accurately describes the history, religion and the power of the most impressive citadel of orcs, and the characteristics, motivations, and goals of its inhabitants. Barbaric killers, bloodthirsty priests and devastating hordes of orcs soldiers are the main offensive force of the fortress.

182965.name: Space
182965.description:
Publisher blurb:

BLAST INTO SPACE

This sourcebook for the What’s O.L.D. is N.E.W. roleplaying game system contains information on space and starship operations.

Astronomical information - scale, stars, spectral classifications, unusual stars, black holes, rogue planets, nebulae, anomalies, astroengineering.

Random space phenomena - from funnel clouds to quantum singularities; magnetars to wormholes.

Space travel - distance & time, setting assumptions, inner system travel, time dilation, types of FTL travel.

Starship combat - tactical (hex-based) and theatreof- the-mind space combat, Newtonian movement, two sample ships (the Murphy, and a Spartan Talon Class VI Scout).

Starship operations - ship classes and types, roles aboard a starship, using sensors, sickbays, tractor beams, transporters, and recreational facilities.

This book requires the use of a What’s O.L.D. is N.E.W. core rulebook.

Do I need this book? The information in this book is also found in its entirety in the N.E.W. roleplaying game core rulebook. If you have that book, you do not need to buy this one. If you have a different WOIN core rulebook and wish to add space elements to it, or if you are building your WOIN ruleset piecemeal, then this book will be useful.

182966.name: Hellsing
182966.description:
Publisher blurb:
A secret war is brewing in the night - a war in which humanity is only a pawn. The mysterious Hellsing Organization deploys within the shadows to protect ordinary mortals from the undead legions that would prey upon us. Now, as the ghouls and vampires increase in number, they threaten the human police forces and force the deployment of the Hellsing Organization's ultimate weapon - the rogue vampire, Arucard! Welcome to the vampire horror setting supplement for the smash-hit anime RPG, BESM d20! This guide covers the entire Hellsing anime series with detailed episode summaries, in depth character profiles, setting and theme analysis, and BESM d20 role-playing character sheets. With hundreds of full-color images from the series, and many pages of production line art, this guide is a spectacular sourcebook for the d20 System.

182967.name: Bun Fight
182967.description:
The Glitterati of Bear Valley Hills are at an awards after-party, someone says the wrong thing, then the cakes start flying! Whoever comes out the other end cleanest is the winner.

Bun Fight is a board game in which players move between tables laden with various cakes to grab and hurl at their rivals.

On their turn, a player has a number of actions enabling them to move to a table, grab a cake, push a cake in someone's face (close combat), or hurl it at someone (ranged). "Sweet Surprise" cards may be played at any time by any player, adding effects or helping players avoid/recover from trouble. Cakes (Just Desserts) cause Splat and Stun, and the player with the fewest Splat when the last cake is grabbed wins. Stun causes a player to miss actions but can be avoided by either dropping a cake or discarding Sweet Surprise cards if preferred.

182968.name: Envoyer (Issue 14 - Dec 1997)
182968.description: Issue 14 includes the usual mix of news and reviews, articles (for instance on playing clerics), an introduction to Paranoia, third part of the scenario "Buch des Lebens", and some riddles and gimmicks.

182969.name: Starship Construction Manual
182969.description:
Publisher blurb:

BECOME A STARSHIP ENGINEER
The Starship Construction Manual enables you to design, build, and customize starships for use with the What’s O.L.D. is N.E.W. roleplaying game. Hundreds of components, from FTL engines to control computers, torpedo bays to particle beams, hangars to deflector shields, all combine to create vessels from the smallest yachts to the greatest battleships!
Additional advice on funding starships and specifications of nine well-known vessel types make this manual required reading at the Navy Academy.

This book requires the use of a What’s O.L.D. is N.E.W. core rulebook. It is fully compatible with the starship combat rules found in other WOIN products.

182970.name: The World of Synnibarr 3rd Edition: The Ultimate Adventurers Guide I
182970.description:
Full title from credits page:
The World of Synnibarr: 3rd Edition
The Ultimate Adventurers Guide I
The Original Scifi-Fantasy Role Playing Game
The Synnibarr player's rulebook

From the cover:
The Synnibarr player's rulebook that contains:
- Adventurer character creation
- Races, guilds, and organizations
- The basic combat system
- The book of the mystic arts

182971.description:
On behalf of the faculty and staff of Masamune Shining Forge Academy, it is with great pleasure that we inform you of your admission to Masamune. You were selected from an incredibly competitive and capable group of applicants, and showed an intense devotion to creating weapons worthy of legend.

Masamune is a game for two to four players, and takes place over the course of an academic year at Masamune Shining Forge Academy. As a pupil at Masamune Shining Forge Academy, you and your opponents will start the game with identical 12-card decks. Over the course of the game, you will forge sentient weapons called Chibis and teach them powerful special techniques to defend the Academy from attacking monsters. Alternatively, you can use Chibis to gain more powerful cards and bolster your deck.

Just like normal schools, Masamune Shining Forge Academy uses Exams to measure its pupils’ academic growth. Every time a new card is added to your deck, there is a chance that the next card drawn from the Academy deck will be an Exam, an intense battle staged by your instructors that lures the monsters teeming in the surrounding forest to attack the Academy! After the fifth and final Exam is completed, the school year is over, and the pupil who harvested the most monsters has won the game!
182971.name: Masamune

182972.name: The Abyss (Issue 41 - Winter 1987)
182972.description:
Abyss
Volume 9, Number 2 - Issue 41
Winter 1987

Letter-sized digest, blue cover

182973.name: Atlantean Temple
182973.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a full-color, 48 inch by 30 inch, Battlemap of an Atlantean Temple , with Hex, Square and No overlay and comes with a Savage Worlds Adventure and a 360 view of the inside of the Temple.

The PDF includes includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play).

“There are too few Atlanteans left to keep the island floating. Drastic measures must be taken.”—High Priestess Teefa

Atlantean Temple is an interior map of a temple and the exterior surroundings. This product includes a 360-degree panoramic view from the west center interior of the temple. This is a land based temple set in an era prior to the fall of Atlantis.

Atlantean Temple is intended for use in fantasy games.

This location is useful as a temple of worship for a god or goddess. It is also useful as a place devoted to arcane magical rituals without devotion to particular gods and deities.

The included Savage Tale, A Chance at Power, has Savage World NPC statblocks made with the Savage Worlds Core Rules by Pinnacle Entertainment Group and a page of NPC stat cards. A Chance at Power is intended for use in fantasy Savage Worlds games.

Even if not using Savage Worlds, the map and panoramic view are generic and system neutral. The NPC descriptions and savage tale can be adapted to many fantasy settings featuring gods and goddesses while ignoring or adapting the Savage Worlds stat blocks.

Adventure hook for this map:

A Chance at Power: As the power of Atlantis wanes, a desperate high priestess sends messengers from the island to foreign lands attempting to lure them to the island with the promise of extended life and more magical power than they ever dreamed of possessing. And if that fails, wealth. One of these invitations makes it into the hands of the player characters, especially if the group has magicians who have gathered some renown in their adventures. The messenger awaits their decision. If yes, he guides them to a boat that will take them to the legendary island of Atlantis…

182974.name: Dosdediez (Issue 8 - Jul 1996)
182974.description:
Dosdediez
Revista Terminal de Juegos de Rol y Cartas
No 8 - Julio 1996

182975.name: Dishonored Definitive Edition
182975.description:
User Summary

Dishonored Definitive Edition has enhanced graphics and comes with all three DLC.

182976.name: Doors to Darkness
182976.description:
From the back cover:

FIVE SCENARIOS FOR BEGINNING KEEPERS

Doors to Darkness provides five scenarios written especially for beginning Keepers and players of Call of Cthulhu. Here you will find horror, mystery, investigation, ghastly monsters, strange magics, and forgotten secrets, as well as plenty of advice about how to run the adventures for best effect.

As well as the scenarios, an essay by Kevin Ross details a wide range of hints and tips on running Call of Cthulhu – guidance any Keeper, new or experienced, will find very useful.

The Darkness Beneath the Hill – A friend's house renovation project leads to unexpected discoveries in Providence, Rhode Island.

Genius Loci – Not all is well at Danvers State Lunatic Asylum and it's down to the investigators to heed a friend in need's cry.

Servants of the Lake – The hunt for a missing person reveals ancient secrets in the wilds north of Kingsport.

Ties That Bind – Strange rock formations have been found in Mrs. Carrington's prized fountain. But these are like no rocks seen before!

None More Black – The death of a Miskatonic University student leads the investigators into unsavoury neighbourhoods and dark business dealings.

Also included are ten diverse and ready-to-play investigators, allowing players to dive straight into the mysteries contained within Doors to Darkness. Lastly, just because these scenarios are written with new players in mind, don't expect them to be a walk in the park! Those who dare to open the doors to darkness will discover just what secrets and dangers lie within!

182978.description:
The year is 008 Post Galactic Colonization. Humans have developed the technology to terraform planets, and it has become a very lucrative business. Terraforming companies now race to newly discovered planets to mold them in the most profitable way possible. They will stop at nothing to satisfy their wealthy investors.

Landed is a competitive tile-laying game where players take control of rival terraforming companies that have simultaneously reached the same newly-discovered planet. All players will sign unique contracts with investors to terraform this new world and claim use of the land. The player who fulfills the most valuable contracts and scores the most points is the winner.

In this 2-4 player, hex tile laying game, you begin the game with 2 contracts and 4 double sided tiles. On your turn, you may complete one of the following actions:

1. Play a tile from your hand, adjacent to any other tile. You may fulfill a contract. Obtain a satellite card if you place a satellite tile next to another satellite tile.
2. Draw tiles until you have a hand of 4.
3. Draw 3 contracts. Choose 1 or 2 to keep and discard the remaining ones. You may have at most 3 unfulfilled contracts at a time.

You may also optionally play 1 satellite card as a free action at any time during your turn.

Play continues clockwise. When the last tile is drawn, the last round begins, with the player who drew the last tile getting the last turn. The player with the most points is the winner.
182978.name: Landed

182979.name: The Sealed Ark
182979.description:
The Sealed Ark is a co-operative game which can be played solo or all the way up to 5 people.

Before you roll the die, you must gather a single focus then roll the die to see where will the spirit appear i.e.
(rolls a 4, a single spirit will appear at that 4th circle.)

Players now have the choice of moving to another circle, perform an ability, banish a spirit or do nothing and keep the focus. If the player rolls a 6 on the die, a spirit will appear at the center of the ark (the void) and a spirit card will be drawn and read out loud and do what it's told.

To win, players must carefully plan out their strategies with each unique spirit of harmony and gather enough focus to seal all 5 circles before the void reaches a total of 9 spirits.

182980.name: White Wolf Magazine (Issue 48 - Oct 1994)
182980.description:
White Wolf Magazine
"Eight Years of Horrific Roleplaying Coverage"
Issue 48 - October 1994

182981.name: White Wolf Magazine (Issue 33 - Sep 1992)
182981.description:
White Wolf Magazine
"Six Years of Independent Roleplaying Coverage"
Issue 33 - November/December 1992

182982.name: Horse & Musket: Dawn of an Era
182982.description:
Horse and Musket: Dawn of an Era is a simple tactical game based on the Hold the Line system that covers the development of musket warfare from Vienna in 1683 and Sedgemoor in 1685 to Appomattox in 1865. Volume I will cover warfare in the west from 1683-1739, when the bayonet replaced the pike.

Battle included are...

Vienna - September 12, 1683 – “We came, we saw, and God Conquered.”

Sedgemoor - July 6, 1685 – The Bloody Assizes

Killiecrankie - July 27, 1689 – Slaughter at Sundown

Fleurus - July 1, 1690 – The French Cannae

Aughrim - July 22, 1691 – Bloody Hollow

La Prairie - August 11, 1691 – Double Ambush

Neerwinden - July 29, 1693 – Le Tapissier de Nôtre Dame

Marsaglia - October 4, 1693 – The Massed Bayonet Charge is Born

Narva - November 30, 1700 – Charles XII Smashes the Russian Army

Chiari - September 1, 1701 – Catinat’s Last Battle

Klissow - July 19, 1702 – Charles XII Invades Poland

Blenheim - August 13, 1704 – “A Famous Victory”

Fraustadt - February 13, 1706 – The Swedish Cannae

Turin - September 7, 1706 – Eugene’s Greatest Victory

Almansa - April 25, 1707 – Battle of the Exiles

Poltava - July 8, 1709 – The Student Surpasses the Master

Malplaquet - September 11, 1709 – Mort et convoi de l'invincible Malbrough

Villaviciosa - December 10, 1710 – A Bourbon on the Spanish Throne

Sheriffmuir - November 13, 1715 – Confusion on the Moors

Glen Shiel - June 10, 1719 – Rob Roy’s Last Battle

182983.description:
Take on the role of mighty shape shifters. By using powerful attacks and assuming the form of mighty beasts the shifters do battle to see who will reign supreme. The first player to empty their hand is the winner of the duel and can lay claim to the title of the Ultimate Shape Shifter.

Play

Select a Form - Each player selects one Form Card from their stack of face down Form Cards and places in the center of the table but in front of them.

Select a Combat Style - Each player then selects one of their combat style cards from their hand and places it face down besides their form card.

Reveal - All cards are flipped face up.

Resolution: The success of a combat style depends on the form.
If successful, players put the Combat Style Card face down in the discard pile.
If unsuccessful, players put the combat style card back in their hand.

End of turn - Players put the Form Card they just used aside, face-up and return any previously used Form Cards back to their stack.

Winning

The game ends when a player ends a turn with no Combat Style Cards in their hand.

Note

This contains all three Transmogrification Games; Transmogrification, Advance Transmogrification and Epic Transmogrification.
182983.name: Total Transmogrification

182984.description:
The Endless Land is a game with modular boards that are placed in a different way each game for a new experience each time! Some players will choose dangerous quests and heroic battles to gain victory. Some will set up commerce and trade routes to conquer the land. There is magic and adventure among the dwarves, elves, and humans that live in this realm. Make sure you have plenty of food for the journey and let the quest begin!

On a turn all players will take their actions simultaneously. They travel to a neighboring town (move their player meeple on the board) and collect the goods which have been accumulating there. The board is modular and matches up with other board parts to form a unique terrain each game. Also, the game expands with more 8" X 10" board pieces to form a playing surface as with no knowable end. Each player uses gold, wheat, wood, iron, and many other commodities to build farms, stores, and implements of combat.
Players may also take quests that send them into the lairs of diabolical monsters who are hoarding gold, rubies, and other valuable items. Players can risk sneaking into the dark caverns and taking the loot, but if the monster awakens they are in trouble.
Players can build strongholds so that even when they are not in a town, that town is building up their store of goods.

Players can trade each turn to turn their wheat, sheep, or cattle into food, they can also trade other commodities for food in a town where that is in demand.

Players can travel faster buy buying a horse or boat.

Players wishing to build or buy must have food to stay in a particular place longer to transact business.

Points are gained by building structures and conquering creatures. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.
182984.name: The Endless Land

182985.name: Commanders: Tactical Strategy Game
182985.description:
Dice-based combat with tile-based resource gathering. Spend resources to expand your armies, upgrade soldiers, or climb the tech tree.

The goal of the game is to capture 20 enemy soldiers. The first player to do this wins. However, if all of one player's soldiers have been captured (they have no more on the board or in their reserve pile), then the player who has the highest number of enemy soldiers captured wins.

The board is made up of hexagon-shaped tiles set up in a large hexagon shape. These tiles consist of six different kinds of resource tiles as well as a base tile in the middle of the board and at each of the six corners.

As players move soldiers from tile to tile, they leave behind Possession Markers to claim those tiles as part of their territory.

If you expand too far away from a base tile, another player could move in behind you, separating your territory from a base tile and capturing your soldiers.

Each turn you may collect one resource card for each soldier you have on the board - corresponding with the resource tiles they occupy.

On your turn, you can trade resource cards with other players regardless of whether or not they are your ally. Your resource cards can be spent on a wide variety of items to help you win.

182989.name: οι αγγελοι του τσαρλι
182989.description:
Charlie's Angels (οι αγγελοι του τσαρλι) - The playing pieces travel around the map, including Hawaii, and gather evidence & points. Winner returns to start with enough evidence & points to tell Charlie the name of the criminal.

Comes with paper board, spinner, 8 generic playing pieces (2 each of yellow, red, blue & green), clue cards and instruction sheet.

182990.name: COLOR: Strategy Board Game
182990.description:
Discover territories, collect resources, build, upgrade and pass through events!

COLOR: Strategy Board Game is a turn-by-turn multi-player game where players are colonizing territories, collecting resources, building connections and mines, discovering hidden lands and passing through positive or negative events.

It can be played by two, up to four players aged ten years and up. The playing time is around 30 to 60 minutes. The game can be easily played even at the very first time without being an experienced player.

182991.name: ΑΣΤΥΝΟΜΙΚΕΣ ΙΣΤΟΡΙΕΣ
182991.description:
Charlie's Angels Police Stories Game from Greece (ΑΣΤΥΝΟΜΙΚΕΣ ΙΣΤΟΡΙΕΣ) - Based on the TV Series. Players try to track down & capture the suspect.

Comes with 4 playing people pieces, 2 cars, colorful paper board, spinner & instructions.

182992.name: Defenders of Knife Edge Pass
182992.description:
A horde of terrible creatures are on the rampage in the East. The defenceless trading village of Hilt (located just to the west of Knife Edge pass) has called for heroes to help defend Hilt and the entire western lands from the oncoming horde. Choose between 1 and 3 heroes to defend the pass, defeat the oncoming horde and claim VICTORY! ... plus Hilt is super rich and has many beautiful, eligible, young men and women!

Construct the Pass using between 3 and 5 double sided cards, construct the Horde deck based upon a chosen scenario and choose between 1 and 3 heroes. Each turn a new monster enters the pass. You will need to upgrade your heroes and use all your skills in order to stop the advancing horde.

Beware! If a single monster makes it through the pass or all your heroes die then you lose.

182993.name: Stockopolis
182993.description:
User summary

The action revolves around a twenty-four card chance deck and a pair of six-sided dice, three numbers of each die are green and the other three are red.

Each player begins the game with $40,000. After the deck of cards is shuffled and placed face down on the superfluous game board, the top card is drawn and read aloud to establish the conditions of trades for that player. That player follows the direction on the card. The dice are rolled and the results are enacted based on the chart on the card.

After twenty four turns, the deck is depleted and the Power Play round begins. Each person, in turn, chooses one last trade and rolls the dice and check the card for each individual result.

The final round of play has each player roll the dice one last time to determine if each player must pay a trading fee.

Now, the game is over and the player with the greatest net worth is the winner.

182994.name: ¿Quién es el más burro?
182994.description: Board game with questions and answers in which you have to guess a character or a place offering clues. The first to reach the final square wins. The board further has a series of boxes that hamper progress in balancing the culture of the players.

182995.description:
Description from the publisher:

“I must have the gold cloaks. The City Watch is two thousand strong, sworn to defend the castle, the city, and the king's peace.”
–George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

Follow the events of A Game of Thrones with The King's Peace, the third Chapter Pack in the Westeros cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. Eddard Stark has arrived at King's Landing to serve as the Hand of the King, but even as knights journey across Westeros to participate in the Tourney of the Hand, insidious characters gather in the shadows. Join battles and intrigues surrounding the tourney with memorable characters like Ser Rodrik Cassel, Ser Alliser Thorne, and Ser Gregor Clegane. Two new plots—one neutral and one loyal to House Baratheon—offer new deckbuilding opportunities and this Chapter Pack includes a brand-new agenda that’s sure to inspire entirely new types of decks.
182995.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – The King's Peace
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Good The Board and The Joe Likes Space Alert Way Too Much: Episode 77 “Programming Games”
The Good, The Board and Political: Episode 60 “Politics in Games”

182996.name: The Swordmage
182996.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warriors stand toe to claw with their enemies, hacking at them with heavy metal blades and counting on layers of steel to keep them safe. While it works, they’re still vulnerable to the immaterial forces of magic.

Wizards are better suited to dealing with that sort of thing, whether it means unleashing elemental forces upon their foes, resisting it, or knowing what’s about to happen. Unfortunately their studies preclude physical activities, so they have to keep a safe distance, lest their flesh by flayed from their bones.

But why choose just one?

Rather than specialize, you weave both spell and sword into a deadly new art. You can hold your own against ferocious monsters in melee, strike from a distance with blasts of fire or bolts of lightning, and even slice through baleful magics should they be employed against you.

This product contains four files.

Two are letter-sized character sheets that use our new character sheet layout. One has a completely blank gear section, while the other fills in the initial choices if you want to just check some boxes and start playing.

The other two are digest-sized books, one in color, the other in black and white (to make it easier to print off at home if you want). They both contain:

The swordmage class, complete with 25 advanced moves.
New armor, dungeon gear, and an artifact: the black blade.
A director's cut with questions to ask yourself when rolling up a swordmage, explanations and suggestions for some of the moves, and some extra moves that didn't make the original cut.

182997.name: Ultimate Charisma
182997.description:
From publisher blurb:

Command, Conquer, Control!

Raise armies, expand your reputation, and secure victory over your foes using Ultimate Charisma, by Everyman Gaming, LLC. Designed for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, Ultimate Charisma gives GMs and players all the tools they need to put their charisma to the test as they recruit a legion of followers, exercise their leadership skills, master a variety of psychological maneuvers, and build lasting reputations and relationships to last a lifetime.

Ultimate Charisma includes:

Leadership, redesigned and retooled into a massive, multi-faceted subsystem that allows players to exercise their influence within the campaign setting in new and exciting ways.
Revised rules systems that allow players to use their leadership skills to attract multiple cohorts and followers and build reputations and relationships while remaining modular.
Psychology maneuvers, an easy to use design that streamlines a character’s ability to manipulate opponents in combat using a combination of words and wits.
New archetypes and character options.
New feats, mythic feats, and combat tricks.
Leadership perks, a new character option that allows characters to specialize and customize their leadership abilities to suit their needs.
New character traits.
And much more!

182998.name: Tournament of Rapists
182998.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tournament of Rapists details the sadistic Rape Pure Fight circuit, expanding on what you’ve seen already and introducing dangerous new sexual predators. This sadistic bloodsport takes place in abandoned office buildings and atop Tokyo rooftops. An assortment of superhumanly powerful and inhumanly misogynistic men, and even worse women, step into impromptu fighting arenas, killing and raping the weaker in search of a multi-billion yen fight purse provided by a half-oni billionaire in thrall to dark impulses.

182999.name: Universal Adventures Tombs of Terror Events
182999.description:
From publisher blurb:

The grating of stone on stone echoes from the darkness. A moment latter an eerie green glow appears in the distance and it begins to draw closer.

Continue to explore the Tombs of Terror, if you’ve the courage. But beware, for even more dangers lurk within the halls and chambers of that dreaded place than ever before. The second expansion pack for the newest Adventure Module, Tombs of Terror, Universal Adventures Tombs of Terror Events brings you 9 Event cards for use with the Tombs of Terror Adventure Module, or any adventure you choose. Add new depths of danger to your Universal Adventures with the Tombs of Terror Events!

183000.name: Lilac Towers
183000.description:
From publisher blurb:

Come Experience Lilac Towers, it’s to die for….

Exposed by a recent landslide, the 11th floor entrance into the once luxurious Lilac Towers is now visible. The PC adventurers find the pathway up to the mysterious ruins while tracking hostile skullock and moaners.

Why would two mutant species who normally hate each other work together? Who rules them? What horrors, and loot, will be found in the buried hotel? Only a closer inspection will reveal the truth.

Lilac Towers is our 5th One Day Dig and was written by Danny Seedhouse. These short, single session adventures are crafted to showcase a bit of The Mutant Epoch setting and flavor, introduce some creatures and relics, as well as offer an example of how the Outland System game mechanic works. While previous ODDs were designed for first rank characters, this one’s a bit more challenging and PCs should at least be of 2nd rank.
